title: It Ends with Us
review: Reflection: it was a story about abuse and like all the emotions on the page merited a trigger warning…i think i’m reacting correctly by feeling overwhelmed with what i’ve just read. you know the idea of “why doesn’t the woman just leave” this book shows it all. we see the characters fall in love and it’s beautiful to see and then the first abusives incident happen and the guys is all apologetic “it was an accident” “it will never happen” and the limit is stretched farther and it happens again. the book shows all the inner turmoil of this woman. she hates this man, but she loves this man. and she has all these feelings about him and herself and they all over whelm her especially with reference to her parents who were also in an abusive relationship. All that to say i was not ready for what i just read, but i’m glad i read it. i thought the author did a phenomenal job getting the reader to see inside the mc head. i felt like i could sympathize despite never having an experience like that

title: The Love Hypothesis
review: my thoughts: the reason i LOVE this book is the way that i felt when reading it. it felt magical. the perfect balance of hardship and love. plus i LOVE the characters

title: You Deserve Each Other
review: my thoughts: kinda got weird/mushy at the end and lasted a bit too long, overall not bad; i think they needed to hit the topic of second chances a bit more, but it was a sweet rom com read. there was a weird imbalance with the job status between the couple. i think that the romance failed to peek through at a moderate pace and ended up just gushing at the end in a way that is similar to seeing a couple smother each other in public, not very comfy

title: The Upside of Falling
review: reflection: Ahh i loved how this book incorporates feelings even if it’s not realistic for everyone. I appreciated seeing the growth of the characters from their interactions and i liked being their heads. there wasn’t any spice so i can safely recommend to others haha!! a wonderful feel good book!

title: The Unhoneymooners
review: reflection: i really enjoyed the writing in this book. i liked that there were several themes that were prominent and reoccurring. i’m always a sucker for a happy ending so the adorable proposal at the end was lovely. would recommend to rom com lovers

title: Beach Read
review: reflection: Augustus Everett is my newest fictional crush to add with all the others. I loved seeing the brokenness of the characters and the perseverance that it took to allow them to be vulnerable. I felt like that was what the story was really about. The love story was an added bonus. all in all would recommend!!

title: In a Holidaze
review: my thoughts: my only problem with this book is that the love interest wasn’t fully clear. i felt like if it were either brother she ended up with there would be forced feelings. overall it was definitely a cute rom com for the holidays.

title: People We Meet on Vacation
review: my thoughts: i really liked the formatting of this book. the prologue unknowingly introduces us to an important scene, and the chapters go back and forth between past and present in a way that’s very easy to follow. i love that there was a crossover from The Beach Read (same author)!! i was so excited that i immediately texted my friend lol. the main thing that i found frustrating was that the characters gave up so easily, like the big event that is mentioned isn’t that big/the fallout didn’t seem very logical. the ending was kind of confusing bc it happens very quickly in comparison to the pace of the rest of the book, and my heart stopped right before the last chapter. overall, i still really liked the book mainly because of the feeling i got and the fact that i kept thinking about it even though i had finished it. (i was trying to figure out why i didn’t feel fully satisfied, and i still don’t know lol. i’m thinking it was the fast ending)

title: The Secret Life of Bees
review: my thoughts: i believe that this book will always have a special place in my heart. the characters, the feelings, and the circumstances are something that everyone can relate to in one way or another. i think it was beautifully written showing the balance of good and bad in the world with an emphasis on our ability to create family by choice. when i finished this book i needed a second to process what happened and i hope that feeling is mutual with other readers.

title: Second First Impressions
review: my thoughts: i definitely liked this book, and my main thing against it is that the characters aren’t people that i can’t fully relate to. i think that’s the main thing barring me from a a greater connection. but i really liked everything else about it!

title: The Flatshare
review: my thoughts: another good romcom book; i would recommend other books before it, but i liked it overall!

title: You & Me at the End of the World
All the Birds in the Sky
Who Do You Love
review: ahhhh this book. so good. i can’t even form words right now. i can tell this book will be one that i can’t stop thinking about. the characters are so well written and most times i don’t like character driven books but this book truly illustrated these beautifully-broken people. we could see their highs and lows when they were together and not. their lives were so separate yet indivisible. i cried several times notably when mr. sills said things. I think i felt every emotion while reading. this story was truly incredible to see these characters navigate race, social status, feelings, loss, work, fame, love, divorce, so much!!! I literally feel like i’ve read a biography of two people in one book. i loved seeing these characters grow from that fateful meeting in the hospital to the lives that they made themselves.

title: Today Tonight Tomorrow
review: yesssss this book. love love love. such a good ya, enemies to lovers book. i loved seeing the complexities of the characters and their transformation of each other. i felt like we got to know them by them getting to know each other and truly be the characters which was so cool. i really like seeing them connect through their experiences with antisemitism and the desperation to prove themselves. i absolute loved the love note in the yearbook and the bench motif (so subtle yet so powerful) my one criticism is how fast it feels (over just one day) but i think the context of loving each other for a while makes it feel not weird. ahhhh so good just a lot of fun and ofc love

title: This Time Next Year
review: i was so sad for this book to end. i loved all the little easter eggs thrown in and way that the characters were “fated” to be together. i loved seeing her find herself before committing to someone and i’m also a sucker for characters who like to serve others. i originally didn’t love the one part where is was super cliche but ended up liking what the author did with it. i’m glad we got to see some of the complexities of the characters and really understand their backgrounds from their families. my request is that i really wish there was an epilogue and more pov from quinn. overall so much fun love love love want to know what happens next! (we’re on a good streak!)

title: The Bride Test
review: the word that stuck in my mind about this book was: captivating. the character growth in this book was *chefs kiss* i absolutely adored the characters how supportive the side characters were. one thing that i thought was curious, i wasn’t really able to tell when they spoke english vs. Vietnamese. this book definitely reinforced how much i really like multiple povs. the perspective from a guy with autism was really interesting to me. the whole emotional feeling of “i can’t love” was really effective in adding tension and character development. i was kinda surprised about the limited reaction to Esme’s daughter Jade but i’m glad it didn’t blow up the entire ending if if i wish she’d told them sooner. this was such a sweet, and a little spicy, book and a solid read

title: Faker
review: my thoughts: 7/10 not a bad read. i felt like the first half was a lot better than the second half. the brooding tension between the pair lasted for 30 percent of the book and then its an awkward mush with the big climax that felt weird to me. I like the characters’ backgrounds and seeing the ethnical representation, and i thought the romance was well written, especially the slow burn aspect. I just felt like their bickering and “hate” for each other could’ve been drawn out a slight bit longer. Overall the story wasn’t bad and i enjoyed reading it, but it didn’t really strike me in a certain way like past books have.

title: The Dating Plan
review: Very much like the last one i loved the characters, i loved the side characters, i liked the plot and premise and it was overall very fun to read. i liked that this one felt complex but there weren’t too many storylines to keep straight like last time. spicy scenes were *clears throat* well written. i liked knowing daisy from the previous book (she was layla and sam’s receptionist) but i felt like both layla and daisy were much different from what i pictured in the last book. i felt like i could relate more to daisy than layla and i liked that Liam’s drive felt more multifaceted. definitely had a fun time reading!

title: The Marriage Game
review: my thoughts: 9/10 this book was so much fun!!! the characters were multifaceted and the side characters were awesome. i loved seeing layla’s confidence grow and i loved seeing sam let go of his past. so much happened in this book i don’t even think i covered it all but it kept the story and plot rich and full. i loved seeing the tension between the two when they finally hit their breaking point of hating to love it was *chefs kiss* the spice was, ahem, very well written. the cultural aspect of family and tradition and just all of it was a super fun read. i loved the multiple povs (especially when the guys is obsessed, in a good way, with the girl) it’s just amazing. loved this book.

title: The Trouble with Hating You
review: my thoughts 8/10: this book is a thinker. the characters are so broken and flawed and we see their actions being decided by their past. but we also see them grow from being with each other and accepting that the past is going to be a part of who they are but does not have to define them. the cultural aspect of arranged marriage, along with abuse and loss was all so sorrowfully mixed together in this book. the pain and grief from both liya and jay made their relationship even more special. i loved liya be a role model of independence but i also liked seeing her lean back on her supports. i was super impressed at jay’s persistence ngl. i loved the banter and hate they had at the beginning and seeing it transform into a formidable bond. truly a wonderful read and very profound message of love.

title: First Love, Take Two
review: my thoughts 8/10: another thinker! i absolutely loved this book and all the complexities it brought to the surface. the depiction of anxiety through Patel’s words was flawless and almost too realistic. the barriers of race and tradition and family blocking love were so eye opening and profound. i think it truly tackled these subjects like no other book i’ve read has. i absolutely loved the crossover from the previous book and would recommend reading it before this one (there’d be a lot of missing content) i think i liked this one better tho because of how i could relate to the overwhelming and consuming anxiety preeti felt. i’m such a huge fan of daniel and their relationship. the perseverance and their love was so beautiful and perfectly matched. i was hoping for some spice but the heated moments had to suffice for now (which i think was appropriate given the gravity of some of the topics) overall very thought provoking and i don’t think fun is the right word but i enjoyed reading this book even though it’s emotionally jarring.

title: The Soulmate Equation
review: my thoughts: 10/10 I loved this book so much. it was so much fun to read and the light hearted was was a perfect mood booster from the past few books. I am newly obsessed with River, he is absolutely adorable. i love juno and was glad that having a child didn’t take away from the story or the relationship. the ending proposal location felt so obvious to me and i was kinda mad at river for not figuring it out sooner but i love how it all ended. i will admit i wasn’t sure how they were going to add tension to a climax in the book and i would say that it was perfect intensity for the plot. (i kinda felt weird about river not saying anything for over a week, maybe only 5 days…idk but yeah) i loved how loving and supportive all the supporting characters were. there wasn’t an overwhelming number of awful people in their lives which made this story more pleasant and lighter which was much needed!! anyway, overall really good read (loved the spicy scenes they were..pretty good…) definitely would recommend! (

title: You Don't Live Here
review: my thoughts 8/10: I thought that this book was extremely powerful. I’d really love if it became a classic that’s read in schools. I have loved past books by Robyn Schneider, and she never fails to blow me away with a thought provoking story. Although I don’t relate to Sasha, I feel like her story is a lot more common than people think and one worth sharing. I really appreciated reading and learning and seeing the life of someone who is bi through this lens. I leave a lot out in the synopsis, but i think that the story truly speaks for itself. highly recommend YA

title: The Wedding Date
review: my thoughts: 8/10 I ended up really liking this book! The climax was frustrating, but i think the beginning and end of the book make it worth it. i was really mad at the characters for being stupid at some points specifically all the assuming instead of just talking about it. ughhhhh!! i liked how cute they were and unashamed they were to be intimate (wished the scenes had been more graphic). i liked that race and gender were considered (although there were a few questionable moments) overall it was super fun and quick read!

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
review: i feel so conflicted…i’m even sure what to write. i guess i’m pleased, but i still feel dissatisfied. nothing that comes to mind is coherent so i’ll leave my thoughts as conflicted but pleased. I really enjoyed the book, although i’m not sophisticated enough to appreciate all the imagery that owens used. i thought the complexity of Kya’s character was extremely well developed and i also liked hearing snippet of others’ povs. i liked the plot even though it left me confused. i don’t feel able to give it a high rating bc i don’t feel happy?

title: The Heart Principle
review: i liked this book. my main concern was how the characters made up…like i know the whole point was that she was able to be very vulnerable with him, but it felt weird..I also was really pissed at her family for being so unaccepting and insensitive. i love Quan, he’s so sweet and i’m so glad he got his happy ending finally. I really wish there was more of a crossover with this book and the bride test but I appreciated the crossover with the kiss quotient. I think it would’ve been really interesting to have the characters who have autism talk about and relate to one another. I really felt like I could relate to how Anna felt about perfectionism maybe not to the same intensity that she had it but I love to seeing her overcome that and stop trying to please people at every waking moment. I like seeing her come to accept herself the way that she is and seeing that support from Quan (he really is a sweetheart) I had fun with this one but I still think that I prefer the Bride Test.

title: Dating by the Book
review: This book took me way too long to finish, and I hate the mc. Ughhhh I felt that she was manipulative. While i can understand the argument that she was hurting or just learning, she is completely blind to social cues and doesn’t seem to care about people until they’re gone. Spoiler Section: She had like four different guys who liked her and she basically rejected all of them. Max being Silver fox sucks bc we never find out what happens to Charlie, like he literally stops existing. My very first inclination was TeamMax, but he was kinda controlling (but also he pours his heart to her and she’s like no) but also I like Charlie and wanted him to be Silver Fox. I can’t really explain what the defining feature of Maddie that I hate but she irks me sooo much and I hate her.

title: The Switch
review: Leena was low key really annoying and the plot was relatively predictable. I like older Eileen she was a girl boss. Overall pretty average but not bad. (6/10)

title: Hook, Line, and Sinker
review: ahhhhhh the ending tho….just sex okay i want to like this book more than I do and maybe it’ll grow on me like its prequel. spice was excellent but the character growth was a weird journey. Like Fox has this deep rooted issues but these issues aren’t given the exposition needed for the reader to understand why he should overcome them. Also i was just kinda pissed that they couldn’t just be honest and be like “i’m so in love with you” but plot ig. i have to give the characters some credit bc they really are adorable together and there was some substance for example the idea of being forced into a stereotype and trying to break it and also finding confidence to be the main character but uhh yeah some of the characters actions confused me lol.

title: A Brush with Love
review: i really enjoyed the complexity of the characters dealing with anxiety, grief, and guilt. i think it added a nuanced perspective to the relationship and the novel. dan was an absolute king and even tho harper had some stuff to work through she was admirable and kinda relatable. loved the slow burn, and while the ending was predictable/cliche i still found it enjoyable. (8/10)

title: Weather Girl
review: i like weather girl for the most part. the spice was good, and slightly unexpected, i liked the mental health awareness piece and reverence to each person’s own journey. i thought the plot was sweet but i feel mostly neutral about the characters. (7/10)

title: Mr. Wrong Number
review: definitely loved this book. the banter and enemies to lovers mwuah and the spice was not too bad either. clearly getting through it in a day is a testament to how much i enjoyed it. the colin beck was yummy to read about (even though his name is dorky). i think this was a lighter read with not a lot of emotional baggage on the characters which was a nice escape. i also liked the trope of not knowing each other to figuring it out. (8/10)

title: The Spanish Love Deception
review: I DID NOT WANT THIS BOOK TO END. AARON BLACKFORD CAN TAKE ME SOUL. THIS BOOK WAS SOOOO GOOD. Everything was *mwuah* all the tropes and enemy to lovers energy plus the spice..Armas outdid herself and I’m excited for her next book. (9/10)

title: No Saint
review: no saint: definitely a turn of genre; dark romance but didn’t hate it, enjoyed the spice; wasn’t the best writing but the “plot twist” was not what i had predicted (was very guessable tho; nothing crazy)

title: Neon Gods
review: this was a cute ya novel. hit a little hard with the mommy issues and the belief that her life could be a romcom was a little much, but wes was adorable and the fact that he’s always had feelings was predictably wonderful. i also dig the playlist at the end of the book (Nov 12 8/10)

title: Better Than the Movies
review: this was a cute ya novel. hit a little hard with the mommy issues and the belief that her life could be a romcom was a little much, but wes was adorable and the fact that he’s always had feelings was predictably wonderful. i also dig the playlist at the end of the book (Nov 12 8/10)

title: Electric Idol
review: neon gods (Nov 12) & electric idol actually i really enjoyed these…uhhh didn’t know i might have a voyeurism kink but doing in front of mirrors? … many stayed for the spice, but i enjoyed that it was a retelling of mythology; also really dig the anti hero male mc solid reads

title: Book Lovers
review: too good, i was so excited about this book. i thought the sister love was a little strong but not necessarily bad. i loved the grumpyxsunshine and the banter and the slow burn and angst. i think i still like beach read the best but nora and charlie were so so cute! (Nov 18 9/10)

title: Strictly Business
review: strictly business this was the book i didn’t know i needed. it was actually sooooo good and unexpectedly. i enjoyed the grumpy sunshine banter, the tension, and the plot wasn’t awful. the families were a little complicated but i thought it added to the story. i also found myself giggling at certain points and the characters are very likable. overall a solid romcom! (Nov 19 9/10)

title: The Rebel
review: the rebel felt like a it happened one summer vibes and wasn’t mad. i thought it was a cute story with a little more substance than the next three smut novels i read…but i like that the child was a foster kid and the plot wasn’t too bad until the end with the unnecessary third act break up

title: Under One Roof
review: under one roof actually so good: tension, pining, unspoken feelings bubbling below the surface, forced proximity, oblivious female mc, overall just love, and the last real chapter *chefs kiss* too short but love that it’s a series of three abt each friend and finally figured out what “novella” means

title: Stuck with You
review: stuck with you also sooo good: misunderstanding, basically soulmates, spicy/swoony, forced proximity, stem gal, friends to lovers to enemies to lovers, really solid read; i was worried but ended up liking the alternating timeline i thought it added to the suspense

title: Shipped
review: shipped: so much fun, so cute. Loved the enemies to lovers, and the combination between the unhoneymooners and the hating game. i loved the feminism and there wasn’t really a third act breakup (i felt like the conflict wasn’t the relationship). i’d consider ya but there were some heated moments. Graeme is a king but his name is so weird and henley is a girlboss also shout out to Marlen who seems like a great boss. ngl i wasn’t ready for it to end

title: Life's Too Short
review: AHHHH THIS BOOK; MY HEART HAS BEEN STOLEN; I CANNOT THIS WAS TOO GOOD; IT WAS LIKE FIVE FEET APART WITH HEA, the original tension, the unspoken feelings (no third act break up? i thought it was more the climax) the heartbreak none the less, the sacrifices and mindset…ughhhh this book was so powerful; totally hit me where i wasn’t ready, just gut-wrenching yet sweet and all the feels

title: The Friend Zone
review: okay i like actually am falling in love with abby jimenez; this was so frustrating but so good…my mind is a flurry. i felt like the second half was a blur of trauma but the hea was worth it. i love the concepts that jimenez plays with—mixing the romance and love with the serious conversations of real life

title: Love at First Spite
review: not gonna lie I was a little disappointed by this book. I didn’t like the third act conflict. I didn’t like the reasoning that was given for the conflict. I didn’t like the mc guy because he was so disinterested and his reasoning, for being distant was stupid. however, the first bit of the story was enjoyable until about the 45% mark. I just felt like they were so quickly friends and the enemies part wasn’t drawn out enough

title: It Starts With Us
review: i think i need to sell my soul to colleen hoover…this book was everything and more. it was just so nice to see lily and atlas’s story especially after all that they went through as children and in the previous book. i loved that there wasn’t necessary a climax moment and there wasn’t any third act conflict. i loved that the characters were already destined to be together but we saw them work through obstacles of life before being able to truly be together. i also love josh and and theo and how they developed atlas’s character and added comedic relief. so so so so good, but wouldn’t expect anything less from coho

title: The Wedding Crasher
review: very fun read! overall i really enjoyed the characters and the cameos from the previous book. my one complaint was that it was a little too wishy washy at times…or abrupt/predictable. i did enjoy the spice and the sass!

title: Just Haven't Met You Yet
review: another very fun read! i enjoyed the mini cameo of this time next year! i felt like i could guess who she’d end up with and at some points the plot dragged (didn’t love that the annoying boss got an hea but whatever), but overall i liked the story and the message of stories and objects (plus who doesn’t love a meet cute)

title: Twice Shy
review: Welllll…gotta say wasn’t my fav. I ended up not minding the characters in the end (they weren’t my fav to begin with) but i can appreciate the social anxiety relatability and no third act break up. i think the mc was a little too quirky for me with her “head in the clouds” fantasy land personality but it was better than the other one in my opinion!

title: Hot Cocoa and Mistletoe
review: this novella was perfect!! the enemies to lovers the forced proximity, the steam! i felt like it was over too fast (little fast paced not the slowest of burns) but very much enjoyed!!

title: Apple Cider and Subterfuge
review: this novella was also so cute!! i liked the forbidden romance and the friendship and the drama with being agents. reminiscent of peraltiago. so much fun! i thought the case was kinda silly but whatever lol

title: Not Here to Be Liked
review: I loved the conversation that it invokes. it’s a conflict that I definitely had in my mind about what it is to be feminist and what’s the right action to take. didn’t like the principal but the mcs are cute (loved the Asian representation) I felt like I should’ve guessed the ending. solid ya novel.

title: The Bromance Book Club
review: this book had me cackling…so so funny i enjoyed the emotional depth that it went into it and seeing the character transformations. i also liked that the spice was used an emotional aspect that was relevant in the relationship

title: Undercover Bromance
review: I think I liked this book better than the other one. I’m definitely a fan of enemies to lovers trope and I like how they incorporated a little suspense into the plot. overall, I really enjoyed the characters too.

title: Dating Dr. Dil
review: I like this book. it was definitely the steam that I was expecting but I really enjoyed it so yeah. I also really like the idea of playing with the concept of what is love and if it’s an illusion, or if it’s something that truly exists (but the male mc was kinda dumb cinnamon roll lol)

title: The Devil's Deal
review: this book was uhhh just (what i assume to be) typical mafia romance smut. not great but then again it’s just trashy smut where all the characters are traumatized

title: The Ex Hex
review: okay why was this book actually so fun? wasn’t expecting the spice (not mad); loved the characters the banter, and the magic. definitely was a short fun read!!

title: Wait For It
review: i ended up liking it more than the middle. i felt like there was a lot of exposition but the slow burn was worth it. i also was wary about the lying by omission parts and awful coworker, but it ended up being worth the anxiety. liked the mc but also really appreciated the side characters solid read!

title: The Meeting Point
review: I actually really enjoyed the serendipity in this book! Although the fmc was a little stupid and the mmc was a little goofy. (The fact that she was falling for Ethan meant that she didn’t have strong feelings for max who technically was Ethan and if Ethan valued his “friendship”…) If you take those out of the equation this book was really fun to read! Plus everyone loves a meet cute!

title: Need Me
review: gotta say i enjoyed this book..the spice was great and at some point you kinda forget what the original exposition is lol. sucker for a HEA tho and i like that it’s a trilogy; wish i would’ve gotten my hands on the first one tho

title: Below Zero
review: this novella was so good!!! the timeline was a tad convoluted but it was so sweet and i loved seeing all three couples together. i wished there was more time spent together between hannah and ian but i still love hazelwood and will likely read anything she gives the public

title: Make Me
review: this book was low-key super complicated with the definition of their relationship and their reasoning wasn’t always sound, but the things people will do for love…pretty spicy and little naughty

title: Chase Me
review: okay not mad at this one; (spice) plus, i really liked the characters and they had more reason than some of the others in this trilogy. i preferred the conflict of knowing the other’s intentions were good but feeling upset by a violation of trust

title: The Kiss Curse
review: yayy! it was so cute to see vivi and rhys have their happy moments before seeing gwyn and wells story. this was super cute and while the climax was a little predictable and the resolution a little sketchy (like she just got her magic back what?) i thoroughly enjoyed

title: The Inheritance Games
review: oh man I really enjoyed this book. The puzzles are really good and I KNEW that harry had to be important. I gotta say I’m a little disappointed that I have to wait a whole nine weeks to read the next one and then probably another nine weeks before the third one, but I really enjoyed it

title: Water Under The Bridge
review: Ohhhh man the stone sisters really nailed this one. Slow burn, no third act conflict, the angst and enemies to lovers, office romance and sweet supporting characters, all so so good (and we can’t forget the good spice either!) This was so worth the wait and I will definitely be reading the new few books in the series!

title: Things We Never Got Over
review: I absolutely adored this book. All the angst at the beginning….so good. Was Knox a complete asshole? Yes. Did he eventually make up for it? Also yes (keyword eventually). wasn’t expecting the thriller aspect…but kinda have mafia romance vibes and i didn’t hate it. Loved Way and Naomi, the spice, the supportive characters like stef and Liza, great way to start the year

title: Crazy Stupid Bromance
review: i enjoyed this book..it wasn’t the best of them but not bad. i was frustrated more with alexis than noah. also i think that it would’ve been interesting to seem a plot line that dealt with alexis overcoming trauma from a physical aspect. not a bad read

title: Isn't It Bromantic?
review: Ahhh this one was unexpectedly my fav so far!! Slow burn, angst, friends with history!! I was kinda feeling like..the Russian? Why? And the synopsis was ambiguous like did Elena actually love him? Would he find he deserves love somewhere else? But they were both such touching people and the angst and fear that they carried was so potent that watching them overcome was so worth it

title: A Very Merry Bromance
review: Aww..I was slightly disinterested at the beginning, but it brought some depth to the end. I was frustrated at Gretchen at first but then the whole abusive brother thing made it make sense. I enjoyed seeing them fight for their relationship

title: The Fine Print
review: Ughhhh this book was too damn good, why is it overrr? I’m glad the third act conflict wasn’t dragged out for too long. I loved the characters, the angst, the hating the fact that other person made them feel this way, the protectiveness, the grandpa connection, the sister and her impact, overall so good

title: Terms and Conditions
review: awww i loved it! there a couple moments where i was like hmmmm, but the spice, and the characters made it worth it. i felt like their emotions were a little chaotic and didn’t match the actions but overall very fun read and i’m excited for the next one

title: Love on the Brain
review: Oh man I’ve been waiting a while for this one. It somewhat lived up to expectations, idk how I feel about the Marie curie obsession or the last minute crime moment but overall I think I got what I came for. Enjoyed the familiarity of hazelwood’s writing

title: Twisted Love
review: Okay so I really liked this one..been waiting for a while now too. I really liked how the characters had to work to rebuild the trust. I felt like it made sense even if it was frustrating. I’m so excited for the next ones in the series the spice and morally gray anti hero was so good

title: Twisted Games
review: Another really good one. I think that I really like the fact that it’s a series and we get cameos of other characters. I was sad it was so separated and that Bridget didn’t have her support system, and I missed the morally gray anti hero part but overall good read

title: Twisted Hate
review: Okay wow this was far less tame than the others as far as tw go. Took me a second but I liked the dominance and the praise. I liked that the characters had to reconcile and there wasn’t too much third act conflict. I already know that she was hinting at Dante Russo!

title: Twisted Lies
review: aww this was also really good. absolutely loved this series. stella was super sweet loved morally gray christian (sucker for someone who’s burn down the world for their love). excited we got a further glimpse into dante and ready for the next. i’m so addicted to ana huang…

title: King of Wrath
review: Really enjoyed! I felt like it was a little choppy at times..like the relationship didn’t move forward consistently, but overall I liked the angst and possessiveness. I also enjoyed the cameos of the other couples. I don’t fully see the girl group as close friends like the twisted girls but still excited

title: From Lukov with Love
review: Awww this was so worth. I was wary at the beginning but I felt like the pressure she put on herself was better explained and their relationship developed quickly in the end. I had a feeling it was “I’ve always loved you” situation. I ended up liking their snark and making their relationship their own

title: Strictly Pleasure
review: This was over before I realized it! I just randomly checked after a bit where I was and it was over halfway. Super quick but fun read. I loved the characters and see the couple from the previous book. The spice was quite good especially over the phone….

title: To Love Jason Thorn
review: This was sweet but turned sexy… Some of the side characters were kinda annoying, but surprisingly I didn’t hate the third act break (it was the climax but it wasn’t too long). I think Jason needed more backstory for why he was such a playboy, but I liked the bro best friend/boy next door trope

title: To Hate Adam Connor
review: This one was so cute…I’m a sucker for enemies to lovers and this book didn’t disappoint. I will admit I didn’t love the pregnancy scare, but I think the closure with Jameson was necessary. They were actually so cute and little aiden too. Loved their story

title: Final Offer
review: Okay I ultimately think we needed more backstory about Lana because her anxiety wasn’t amped enough for readers to justify her turning away cal. I would also want to read more childhood memories, but I did love seeing Cal’s sobriety journey and their inevitable love.

title: Lucky Hit
review: There wasn’t enough struggle…I felt like there weren’t any stakes. I mean I guess there several but none of them were actually large and the attempt to make it look like he was cheating was lame bc even the Ava knew that Oakley was whipped….spice tho

title: Blissful Hook
review: Okay the first 2.5 books of this series are just bad…they just are took me wayyy to long to finish and the plot just was inconsistent and the characters were annoying….i just don’t know is Cowan is my kinda author

title: The Sweetest Oblivion
review: Wait…this was so good. It’s been on the forever. The mafia the romance and spice the forbidden choices. Elena was an absolute girlboss for just causally stealing 2 mil. Such an improvement from previous few reads!

title: The Maddest Obsession
review: Other than the pregnancy plot hole and slightly horrifying dumped on childhood trauma from Christian this was a fun read! Liked the storyline and structure especially after reading the previous series :( spice was excellent; my new type is a brooding hot morally gray foreigner

title: Black Ties and White Lies
review: Also really enjoyed this book…the spicy scene was 5 chapters long somehow? I feel like she tried to get away with the obsessed stalker trope but like I don’t care either way…I like that it’s a standalone, and the actual spice wasn’t too bad either

title: Things We Hide From The Light
review: Too freaking good. I think the fact that I stayed up until 4:30 is a testament to how much enjoyed it. I felt like in comparison to the first one it was less chaotic (not having a child made the plot line much simpler, but equally enjoyable) overall becoming a Lucy Score fan (excited for final one!)

title: A Not So Meet Cute
review: This book was also so good. Couple of weird mood swing moments but I don’t mind since it’s in character; I dug the fake engaged and fake pregnancy trope and I audibly laughed several times. Gah I love the broody billionaires; starting to love Quinn

title: So Not Meant To Be
review: Oh man the third act break up really bothered me…I read some good reads reviews and I think we can all concur that Kelsey was not our fav protagonist; i wish that she didn’t feel like she had to rely on other for her self worth and didn’t assume the worst about JP; still enjoyed tho!

title: Untying the Knot
review: Okay I feel like this book tried to be complex but was just toxic..I felt like there was manipulation on both sides and definitely hurt but the whole first half wasn’t funny prank haha it was hmmm shouldn’t they just sit down and talk (also I’d recommend therapy for abuse and trauma) and my final not is that the story would’ve been enriched had we seen Ryat deal with being emotionally vulnerable as well and letting Myla be a protector

title: A Long Time Coming
review: Okay definitely part of the top two favs in the series along with the first one. I liked the friends to lovers and I think it followed a standard trajectory. I just personally have secondhand embarrassment from the cringe of the friend figuring out they have feels and the other is in a relationship. I did love the banter and playfulness. No third act break up!

title: By a Thread
review: So this book and the last two have been like fever dreams where stuff happens and my brain goes “I guess that makes sense” I don’t really understand what was happening at the beginning because Ally was like “I don’t want to rely on you” but also “you’re rejecting me” and dom was all “I don’t want to want you.” Then the reconciliation was short (not that complaining); it was a fun read

title: Reluctantly Yours
review: This was so sweet; really enjoyed this one, gives strictly pleasure vibes; did have a moment of “wtf was the third act break up” like I understand the reasoning but like it was so abrupt, but the reconciliation made it worth; I’m excited for the next one!

title: Highest Bidder Collection
review: Even tho highest bidder is technically 4 books im writing the review as one; okay easy fav is the last one no weird stuff with the spice more tender and romantic rather than bread (fr) ? I can say with certainty that I’m a ok with being vanilla and not traumatized (4, 1, 2, 3) maybe switch 2 and 3 idk I don’t like the 24 hour power exchange thing like a kink ok, but a lifestyle….not for me also why actual whipping is it really necessary? The last one was the kinda book I was expecting and so I’m glad they pulled through in the end but uh….I think I’ve had my fair share and I’m ready for the less freaky stuff

title: First Down
review: Truly I enjoyed reading this book immensely however the extended epilogue kinda sucked and left a bitter taste in my mouth…like the whole point is that the characters have developed and they are in their HEA. I didn’t mind the behaviors of “not knowing her worth” in the book bc it was her overcoming it but the epilogue was just not it…the book itself was never really fake dating but I liked how their relationship evolved and the spice was pretty good…I’m just so sad that the epilogue ruined it a little…but I liked the actual book!

title: Breakaway
review: Ahhhh it was soooo good! No third act breakup, good character development, good spice, dorky vibes, all so so good. And! The epilogue was also super good and so sweet. Ahhhh I liked this book sooo much!

title: Punk 57
review: The best way to describe this book is angst. While the bullying wasn’t something I related to the need belong or fit in resonated. I think Douglas did a good job incorporating emotions of guilt, regret, frustration and it so perfectly fit it’s title. Not totally my style but not bad!

title: Icebreaker
review: I enjoyed this book! I would give it a higher rating if it didn’t drag as long. I felt like I liked the first half much better than the second half and the mc kinda annoyed me in the second half; but credit should be given for the good enemies to lovers; overall not bad

title: Throttled
review: This was so so good!! No third act break up; good enemies to lovers; good length grumpyxsunshine; I like that he went to therapy; I’ll admit the pacing wasn’t always consistent but I still really enjoyed

title: Collided
review: I loved except I didn’t agree with the climax. Sophie can’t expect Liam to know she loves him (Liam also had a bad response)…but I choose to ignore both and I say it was a wonderful, fun and enjoyable read!

title: Wrecked
review: This book was heartbreaking but I loved it. It ended how I wanted it to and just *chefs kiss* the enemies to lovers, the traumatic backstories, I knew from the playlist that it would be sad but I appreciated the message of hope

title: Redeemed
review: I was very close to giving an 8 because it wasn’t fucking Santi’s fault or his sorry to tell but it was rectified with a Say Anything moment and a realization of good intention. Gahh I can’t believe his series is over!! Loved this book and how it was a comeback to F1 rather than developing as a driver. Asher becoming a fav author

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
review: I liked this story and I appreciated a different perspective; the old Hollywood vibes, scheming, and discernment of what it means to be true not only to others but to yourself; overall fun read!

title: The Cheat Sheet
review: Aww this one was cute!! The characters were fun and I enjoyed the friends to lovers (sad no spice) but still fun read. The angst of they both liking each other was like serendipity when the elevators are just a few seconds too late, ended up being faster than anticipated and enjoyed!

title: The Bitter Rival
review: This book was actually so bad…it was like hmmmm spicy scenes how can I make a story out of this. Why did the characters have so many sudden epiphanies? I swear Sebastian character changed just randomly; and all the stupid unnecessary plot devices and trying to do the most with characters, just awful book but okay spice

title: The Distraction
review: This book was alright! I enjoyed it but it didn’t have that gahhhh I love it factor to bump it up a rating. I liked the characters even tho they were a little dense at times…but the spice and short lived “forbiddeness” of love was fun!

title: The Protector
review: I’m torn between the 7 and 8..I liked it more than some of the other sevens but not as much as some of the 8s so…I thought the premise had potential and I didn’t mind the macho man, but it was just strange at times with weird plot movements/character changes but overall not bad

title: The Substitution
review: Awww I really liked that one..I’m tempted to give a nine…but the incorrect grammar/syntax bothered me (use the correct quote “”). I thought it was a interesting twist to see Autumn so cruel and overall I liked the depth and message of the book with being your own person and not the BTeam; also really liked that the characters mirrored each other and the obnoxious actions on both parties were acknowledged/adequately justified

title: The Connection
review: This felt like a solid eight…the climax was def cliche and he had a 180 pretty quickly after Tony’s talk (which is probs a good thing) but it wasn’t bad overall! Liked the characters and nuance with the child, kinda feels like I’ve read this kind of book thousands of times but I don’t care! Still good

title: The Playlist
review: Ehh not a great way to end the series…I didn’t like the “conflict” and everything just kinda happened without a reason…there was definitely potential for this book to talk about mental health and anxiety but yeah wasn’t a huge fan of it all; the spice wasn’t too bad tho.

title: Stealing Home
review: Alrighty so I enjoyed this book but idk if reverse grumpy sunshine is super my thing. I was hoping for Mia to apologize before Sebastian tried again but in the end it was all good. Overall still really like this series and Reilly as an author

title: King of Pride
review: Ana huang coming in with another fun read; is it an original story per se uhhhhh nope, but was it fun with likable characters and sex…yes. Fun times; liked the cameos with the other characters; wished that some scenes had been more explicit but you win some you lose some

title: Our Scorching Summer
review: My biggest issue with this book was coherence and consistency. I think it was mainly the FMC being all wishy washy like expecting things out of the MMC yet denying feelings and pushing away which I guess was the point of the book…but maybe friends to lovers just isn’t my style; still enjoyed tho and the apology/reconciliation made me feel better

title: The Worst Best Man
review: I was a little worried about that third act breakup resolution but it ended up okay (wouldn’t have gone for the full proposal but whatevs) not a horrible read but not as engrossing as some of my other (another repeat story that kinda felt dragged) and I didn’t connect as much with the characters

title: Vacation Wars
review: Oh man; I really enjoyed this book until the end (third act break up). I thought they way they originally handled the relationship with transparency was refreshing but the juvenile immaturity of keeping a document from high school wasn’t cute (like at that point cmon it’s laughable). I felt like Myles and Tessa had moments that hit a little too close for me but overall I still enjoyed. I also wish we had an alternating timeline of like present with integrated stories of their childhood vacations!

title: Accidental Attachment
review: This one was actually pretty fun! Not a fan of the third act break up but it was more a slight annoyance than a deal breaker. I found the FMC quirky but it felt endearing instead of awkward, and the MMC didn’t really have a flaw except that third act break up ego, but still a fun read; loved the forced proximity (and the epilogue was effective; I want more)

title: Disorderly Conduct
review: Okay okay so not awful…MMC def manipulative in my book and not my jam, but overall I didn’t hate the book (probs bc I liked the spice lol). Liked the side characters; plausible backstories that made kinda sense (but the whole mistress thing was weird). Not bad, not great

title: Indecent Exposure
review: I liked some of the depth that this book went into but the timeline of which all these events happened screws up the plot. Like you don’t have 5 revelations in the span of 2 days, but I still liked it overall I found the characters to be more like able and less creepy than the first book in this series

title: Unexpectedly Mine
review: AHHHH THIS BOOK WAS SO GOOD. Okay I get that I said the whole two week thing wasn’t plausible and it still isn’t but the actual moments of connection made it more believable. Pls tell me where I can find a man like Griffin thank you. It was slow burn but also not thankfully no third act breakup and I loved the characters and side characters and I was hooked from the beginning (after initially being skeptical about the marriage of convenience) BUT SO SO GOOD SUCH A FUN READ

title: Strictly for Now
review: I gotta say another solid read!! I really didn’t like the FMC’s family but I’m glad they had a kinda reconciliation. I thought that there could’ve been a few more moments of the main characters developing their relationship, but I really enjoyed overall and the epilogue was hilarious. The characters were likable the plot wasn’t too cheesy and we love a supportive MMC

title: Heartbreak for Hire
review: WHY WAS THIS BOOK ACTUALLY SO GOOD?!? Definitely took a less light-hearted, playful tone and the development felt inconsistent at times, but wow what a concept and the reconciliation/resolution felt so satisfying bc of the chaos of it all. I feel like I ended up really liking the characters and plot plus we got the spice. Very fun read

title: Counting Down with You
review: God this was so good. I think the mirrored struggle and cultural differences and perspective were woven beautifully into this book. That inner conflict of wanting to honor family but also set out on an individual path was palpable, and the resolution extremely gratifying. Was a YA but it was still so cute and cheesy at times; such an fun, insightful read!

title: Charlie, Love and Clichés
review: I LOVED THIS BOOK GIVE ME ALL THE CLICHES LOVE LOVE LOVE. The forbidden-office-second chance romance and the family who sucked but the supportive friends just too too good. Please where can I find these unicorn people. The characters were likable and fun and the slow burn spice and palpable tension. Such a good read

title: The Wedding Confession
review: I felt really meh about this book. It wasn’t awful, but the writing wasn’t great. I think there should’ve been more hints about the MMCs feelings all along, and I felt like there were often random 180s on the characters’ personalities. Not awful quick read!

title: Marriage for One
review: This was a book with a few highs and a few lows. I feel like this was more like her “To blank” books so it wasn’t awful but it wasn’t like her newest one. The characters changed their mindsets willy milky which always bothers me. Definitely a solid read but not my fav.

title: Radiant Sin
review: This book wasn’t bad!! I’d say an improvement from the last two books I’ve recently read. The ending felt abrupt but I think it’s bc it leads into the next book. I really enjoy the books that aren’t polyamorous bc the whole polygamy thing weirds me out. The characters were likable kinda reverse grumpyxsunshine action and the spice ;) anyways fun times!

title: The Wrong Mr. Right
review: Yayyyy this was another fun one! I liked both characters reconciliation. I felt like the MMC needed a little more development, but otherwise such a good read. The tension the possessiveness the bookstore the personalities, the spice ;) , all very enjoyable to read

title: That Kind of Guy
review: Awwww this was so cute!!!! It felt like it was over too quickly but so so fun. I wanted a better transition from the arrogance from the MMC and maybe a “don’t let others comments define you” moment but overall I liked the characters and the arc even tho choppy at times made me happy and the spice ;))) lovely & good vibes

title: In Your Dreams, Holden Rhodes
review: Gosh I’ve really liked this series so far. The second chance romance is just so fun and the characters were likable. I was worried about that third act break up but it ended up being okay. I do wish FMCs love for Queens Cove was played up a little more. Love the side characters still and overall fun read with good spice

title: Finn Rhodes Forever
review: This book was such a great end to the series. I was worried it would be too similar to the previous book but I really like how the MMC arcs were so different. The third act climax was perfect bc it was like a mutual fault/“you deserved the world and I’m not sure I’m good enough for you.” This entire series had moments where I was cackling swooning and overall I really enjoyed.

title: The Heartbreak Rule
review: I really enjoyed this book my one qualm was that I didn’t want that third act break up to be so long like gosh get over yourselves and the awkwardness of the bff situation was…ehh. Overall tho I enjoyed reading. I liked that they had moments where we could see the relationship actually grow which I find important to the plot and story. Fun read!

title: Love, Theoretically
review: I swear some of these MMC are freaking unicorns didn’t fully see how he lied but I get the “lying by omission” still I loved FMC and seeing her character arc simply so satisfying to see her become confident and find happiness in her authentic self; all around such a fun read plus the spice ;)

title: Secretly Yours
review: Oh man I really did not like this book, was wanting it to be over…didn’t like FMC and grew to dislike MMC too. I didn’t feel like there were strong “why’s” —like I didn’t want to root for them. The plot was inconsistent and Bailey seems to like the miscommunication trope…I also found some of the infatuation stuff just juvenile, weird, and annoying rather than sexy; spice was def 10/10 but everything else was a let down..

title: The Sixty/Forty Rule
review: This was so cute and fun! I felt much more conviction for the characters and although the plot was inconsistent at times I appreciated the moments of growth in the relationship and in the characters. God we love a man that pines and the reconciliation wasn’t too long. Overall very fun read and I’m excited for the second one!

title: The No-Judgment Zone
review: Awwww this book made me so happy. No third act break up and deserves a medal for it. The characters were so lovable and I felt like the whole “not in touch with emotions, but want to learn for you” was so endearing. I wish that there was more about the first night they met and the childhood home first time struck me as odd but overall it was so sweet and I loved it

title: Disturbing His Peace
review: I mean def a smut book and def by Bailey I love how she uses “shaking like a fucking leaf” or the “i will tell them” only to not tell them and have it blow up in their face (even tho it doesn’t seem like a big deal….) in several books. Not a fan of the climax/TAB and there were some scenes where I was like that def doesn’t happen irl also weird reconciliation/resolution but okay ig; not an awful read but not great

title: The Chemistry of Love
review: Ehh. This book started out great and gets points for a good assist but it was not a slam dunk. I liked the premise and the initial banter/science jokes but then there were a few plot holes and a few random “I don’t think that was the intention of that statement” moments that turned me off from the FMC. I really wished to see more moments highlighted to show how the relationship helped both of them change for the better. Overall ehhh, but not bad also booooo no spice

title: Make It Sweet
review: God this book was so good. I LOVED that the characters were so mature and reasonable. It was truly refreshing to see them not assume the worst and to respect one another’s decisions. I wouldn’t say there were large amounts of character development but the development of the relationship was beautiful to read; loved the forced proximity, good side characters, spice, overall such a good read and let me reiterate how much I appreciated the maturity and reason levels and the baking was so sweet (literally and figuratively)

title: The Billionaire's Wake-up-call Girl
review: Wait I loved this one. Gosh this was sooo funny and cute and spicy and perfect. I would only change one thing and it was the begging for her to stay/not communicating about the subletting. It redeemed itself in the end when she comes to her own individual resolution to stay and overall I really loved this book. Characters and banter were fun; good growth/reasonable obstacles; everything resolved (like I’m glad she got her credit for her work and it wasn’t just forgotten) anyways all around so much better than the first and honestly loved the premise (cackled at the “wake up motherfucker”)

title: Most Eligible Billionaire
review: Okay so not great. First off “Vonda” really?? Didn’t love the characters; didn’t love the plot or the choices the characters made; definitely inconsistent; the dog whispering? Dog controlling a company?? No way would that be allowed right?? good spice—weird moment tho; overall not great, didn’t like

title: Dear Enemy
review: I enjoyed reading. Maybe not to the extent of her other book, but in the end the opposites mirroring on another worked for me. I didn’t like that she held on to a lie but I’m more outraged that she looks bad for holding the lie while we only find out about HIS lie when all goes to hell. Like make the characters equally look bad imo. Anyways the lead up felt good until the lie by omission, spice was good, enjoyed enemies to lovers, glad third act “need for space” bc it wasn’t actually a break up didn’t last long and the characters were relatively intelligent

title: Breaking the Billionaire's Rules
review: Not bad. Better than the first but not the second. I was okay with most of it but the plot felt inconsistent at times and I wish there wasn’t so many “mini climaxes” overall wasn’t bad and enjoyed the friends to enemies to lovers

title: The American Roommate Experiment
review: This book was so good. I really like Elena Armas and her works so far. I don’t feel like this book stood out necessarily but I still feel like it was a very enjoyable read. Loved the characters and their quirks and the cameos from the first book. Overall pretty good!

title: Unexpected
review: Oh what to give this one..there were moments I liked and moments I didn’t. It felt long, but I liked that there were occasional highlighted moments. The FMC (Amelia) kinda annoyed me but it got better as she recognized her actions and behaviors ALSO she had so much trauma in comparison to MMC (Nick) like geez even out the trauma so they can both grow like once he got over his player mood which was like 20% in he stops growing…he’s just a unicorn. Why the hell did the (not) brother have so much input??? Although I think that Blaise hit the mark with the “do you not trust me enough to tell me” part. And the ending was weird..with the whole Sam thing. I wish they left it with the Dylan (abusive ex) trauma and not added the Sam (dead ex) trauma. Overall not bad but definitely things I would change

title: Bide
review: Gosh this book was so much better than the first imo. I liked the growth of the characters a lot more (that he was always a nice guy even tho he didn’t grow necessarily; that she learned how to trust) My one qualm was how it was kinda toxic for them to say for certain they’d get back to together and also the physical stuff without setting the boundaries of the relationship but hey Alcohol. Overall a book that was 100 pages longer felt 200 pages shorter! Idk just liked it better? He was less of a hero saving from a big bad ex and rather a challenger to get outside the comfort zone which I liked.

title: Rule Number Five
review: This was a solid read. Not my fav but it wasn’t horrendous. I felt like Sid’s apprehension kinda dragged but I liked the original banter and that the author gave moments. I do feel like the switch was very fast and the book could’ve been shorter bc of that but overall not bad!

title: Rules of the Game
review: Kinda same feelings as the last one. I liked the beginning and there was so much potential for the end but alas. I think that the one breakup should’ve been the first one and then the second chance not have a breakup. But whatevs. I also think this book should’ve been first bc I’m a chronological girly; overall not bad!

title: Stolen Heir
review: I think I liked this better than the first one. Though maybe the bar is on the ground…However! There must be credit for another no third act break up and while they leaned a little too hard into/lacked subtlety with the Beauty and the beast story still an overall not mad, not bad.

title: Brutal Prince
review: I’m not sure if the plot was fast bc I was invested or bc it was simply inconsistent…not bad but I think the turning point of enemies to lovers felt abrupt, tbf it’s a mafia romance so my expectations weren’t that high lol. Overall not mad, not bad!

title: Savage Lover
review: Okay wait I really liked this one. I liked the characters and how they influenced on another. I like how they took care of each other. I liked the Bonnie and Clyde moment. I really enjoyed this book overall. I really gotta say how glad I am that Camille was upfront with Nero about the CI stuff and being used as a rat (instead of the “I need to tell them” trope and then not telling them and then they find out and then third act break up). Anyways I really really liked this book!

title: Bloody Heart
review: Yay. I also really liked this one. I had a moment where I was annoyed with Simone for not telling Dante but like overall this was so fun! I will also say that i didn’t love the antagonist of the book like he came outta nowhere. However I liked the flashback as the exposition and still was very pleased overall

title: Broken Vow
review: This one was fun! I liked how it was kinda removed from the whole mafia scene a little bit. I was a little wary of the lack of vocal consent in some scenes but overall both seemed willing participants. I kinda like the double plot too. Overall feels like a not mad not bad!

title: Heavy Crown
review: Argh this was the worst one…ehhhh. She literally lied to him the entire time, the reconciliation was patchy at best like it was like someone snapped their fingers had sex and called it good…fork that. They didn’t even have that great of a relationship like that was completely sped past. THEN! He didn’t actually reform or anything. I think that he should’ve had a heart to heart with what everyone was saying about “letting the dads honor go” not dig deeper into the mafia argwk f i so so mad. Should’ve just given the entire thing to miko and gone and become a legit family too!!! Gahhhh I’m so mad. I wanted HEA not lead ins for the next series…not okay.

title: Contractual Obligations
review: Wait wtf that was incredible. Like wait. Time what just happened. This book was amazing. MMC unicorn. There was struggle but there was learning and the growth of communication in the relationship and the characters and the omg. I’m obsessed. The only weird thing I found was that they were married for so long before anything happened but ig it makes more sense for the authoring a series (but my keen sense of curiosity is not smushed by impending parental expectations). Holy shirt tho this was rly good.

title: To Make Matters Worse
review: It got better but like ehhh. The best friends were annoying with the whole ticking time bomb stuff. I felt like there were a lot of managed emotions and stuff which was just frustrating to read. I did like that they got better with communicating with one another but apart from the main relationship everyone else was annoying.

title: All Downhill With You
review: Awwwwww. I loved this one!!? And! I can already anticipate the next three couples…;) it was so cute and totally what I expected and wanted from a cute rom com grumpyxsunshine/enemies to lovers. I love the characters the side characters the all of it. (Ofc can’t forget the spice ;;;) So good, very please and happy

title: The Fiction Between Us
review: This series is actually so cute!!!! I love the community, and I like that the characters aren’t annoying. With the reverse grumpyxsunshine and the friends to enemies to lovers it was *chef kiss* I think I’m also excited to see the seedlings of the other relationships from the next books. Overall I really dig this universe and I appreciate that the author doesn’t make it longer than it needs to be but also adds enough complexity to keep the story entertaining.

title: Their Freefall At Last
review: Gah this book broke my heart and mended it back together. My one request was that instead of an engagement it was moving in together and instead of a wedding considering an engagement. I think the point could’ve gotten across without actually making it to the wedding day bc Ruby could’ve still encouraged Bennett to go after Jolene with a proposal. But that’s my op I think it’s just so frivolous and cliche to get all the way to the wedding day. HOWEVER this was such a good book. I loved the crumb trail from the previous books. I’m a sucker for a childhood romance (Who Do You Love??)))). Anyways it was so beautiful and fun to see their relationship start and grow and blossom and go into hibernation and then be re seeded and etc. They were actually soo cute and this series was came to such a happy conclusion for me. Overall very pleased

title: Our Ride To Forever
review: I feel like a broken record but this series is simply too cute. I wasn’t expecting the marriage of convenience but it’s not bad. I’m glad there wasn’t any real breakup and the confusion at the beginning was kinda fun. I like that she was able to help him and encourage him to adjust his life to help his health and that he helped validate her beyond being the “vacation friend” overall still loving the series

title: Happy Place
review: Emotionally wrecked. I would say that I wish that it didn’t seems like only Wyn’s fault at the beginning but now I kinda see it as metaphor for Harriet’s mindset being limited or in denial or not understanding the full picture. I loved how the tension grew and while I knew it was the cliche “I don’t want things to change,” I thought it was beautifully done. I also really like how everyone made mistakes and how it was clear that they took responsibility and learned not only from the mistake but also how to communicate better from learning. I loved the “happy place” motif and how she universally used the term. Overall it was so good and a perfect #100 for the year.

title: Go Fake Yourself
review: Awww that was fun and creative!! I’m really curious got this experiment would go in real life but I feel like there were some points that seemed more realistic not all but a few. Overall it was fun to read!

title: The Write Place
review: Ehhh I wasn’t really feeling this book…maybe it’s my own mindset but I didn’t feel very invested in the characters (especially not in the end) the third act breakup was stupid and not for good reason and overall was meh. I will give credit for the first part of the book but it was a train going down hill

title: You Can't Fight Molecular Attraction
review: Wait this book was so good!!! I didn’t really have any critiques..?? Maybe a few more moments of the MMC and FMC together to see the relationship together like in stead of saying “they talked all the afternoon” giving a few more snippets of conversations and also maybe a few inside jokes for them. Overall I really enjoyed!!!

title: In Too Deep
review: Aww this was a cute story! Overall I don’t have any critiques but I always have the underlying dread with office romances bc I know something bad is probs coming. However it wasn’t too bad. Ig I also was confused how quickly the MMC changed his mind on marriage and kids but like if they’re the one..? Overall not bad not mad

title: In His Eyes
review: Ehhh okay it was good but the third act disconnect (wasn’t really a break up) was actually so stupid. Like he didn’t even give her the benefit of the doubt. How could he know and love her for a decade but not give her the benefit of the doubt???? I get the whole trauma but at least let her say her piece and not just ignore her completely. ALSO, how did her emotions just switch from he’s a player to i wanna fork him…what??? Was it that he dealt with her brothers so kindly (which was another weird addition) overall I just feel weird about this book there were moments I liked but I just feel stunned and a bit frustrated. I think the whole “Saria and Ian getting into the car thing” should’ve been played up more than the fake driving least have been dealt with equally. But anyways…

title: In The Wild
review: Okay yay! A good end to the series. I was a little wary at first bc of the previous book, but overall it all ended in a pleasing way. I’m glad that Saria was the one to fix things kinda (but that Harry didn’t chase her to the next town or anything crazy) and that she waited to try to improve herself before trying again with Harry. All in all, not bad!

title: Faking Ms. Right
review: YAYY!! Alright I knew what the third act break up would be about but I’m glad it didn’t last too long. And there’s the comfort of knowing what will happen. Obvi I wish that Shep hadn’t rushed to make a decision before fully hearing out Everly but I thought it was really cute how her friends advocated for her and got his head out of his ass. Overall loved the grumpyxsunshine and the character development!

title: Falling for My Enemy
review: AHHHH this was so cute!! I loved the nerdy, quirky vibes. It was honestly adorable. I wasn’t a fan of the miscommunication trope but I wasn’t mad and I was pleased with how things resolved themselves. I loved how they mirrored each other despite being enemies; gotta love enemies to friends to enemies to hate lovers to friends with benefits etc etc. Overall I really enjoyed all the cute quotes and quirks of this read!

title: Marrying Mr. Wrong
review: Another fun one! I gotta say one moment that really stuck out to me was when Cox had a moment of rash decision making and apologized for it. I really liked how that growth of communication was added into the story even it was a one step forward and three steps back. I loved that Sophie’s thing was clumsiness and that Cox just didn’t think marriage was for him (but that could’ve been hit harder). Overall I enjoyed!

title: Flirting With Forever
review: OMG wait that was so sweet. This entire series was a win for me. I was thinking to myself I hope that this third act breakup has to do with something that’s not like a last minute thing but rather an integral part of the character/plot and I felt like the someone using another’s name was perfect. I also really liked the formula of originally the friends getting the guys head our of his ass to the husbands getting the guy’s head out of his ass. I also really appreciated how good of a dad Dex is. SO glad it ended happily and the bonus epilogue was too cute!

title: West Side Love Story
review: I liked this one. I appreciated the nudges towards Romeo and Juliet even tho they weren’t subtle. I like the culture aspect and the value of family. I wanted more spice the slow burn was good but then it faded to black :( oh well. I don’t know if I’d say I was totally and utterly enraptured but it was a good story overall and I can appreciate a Latinx author.

title: Things We Left Behind
review: BAHHHHH UGLY CRYING but not really but omg I don’t want this series over. I was not ready for the second climax tho like woah our heroine almost died TWICE. I could give critiques but I don’t want to bc I thoroughly enjoyed and the spice was fantastic. I loved see the characters from previous books and I loved the flashbacks, would’ve loved more too. Overall what a good series. I delayed finishing and didn’t realize there was a second climax lol bc I didn’t want it to be over :((((

title: Behind the Net
review: This was a really fun read! I don’t think the grumpy part of grumpyxsunshine lasted very long…but the spice ;) I liked the MMC better nothing against musician but that just wasn’t my vibe. I was so relieved there wasn’t a third act break up. overall good vibes, good read

title: The Wedding Menu
review: Oh god this was almost worst than the first like god the chapters were just all out of order and the timeline broke my brain. I needed a more linear plot and a dual pov. I really wanted to hear the MMCs pov bc that would’ve added a lot more and better insight but whatever. I just don’t think this author is my vibe.

title: Desserts for Stressed People
review: My biggest frustration with this book was that you can’t accuse someone of doing something bad and not confront them only to do the same thing to them. Like the whole getting caught in the act bit? bs just like be honest but whatever. I didn’t really like how the characters said I don’t want anything else to do and then she kept pushing…but the last part was okay. Overall meh

title: Landlord Wars
review: Huh..well that happened. I was really hoping for more spice. Overall just a meh feeling. I liked it but it wasn’t like invigorating I want it to never end vibe. Characters were relatively likable but I wanted more spice and there wasn’t a lot of exposition so you were thrown into the story…but overall not bad

title: Red Summer
review: Things just happened without explanation…..like it was just a series of events that didn’t flow in the way that they should have. Maybe I was skim reading but I just felt like they didn’t have enough moments of getting to know one another…anyways at least it was spicy

title: Where We Left Off
review: Omg this was so bad. There was no rhyme or reason to anything the characters had no ambition and would literally change opinions on a dime and were not relatable and wtf was going on with everyone being step siblings and why oh why if the MMCs father knew who the girl that broke his sons heart was why oh why would the father pursue that girl’s mother. So so so bad, didn’t know why anything happened…not even considering reading the next ones

title: Night Shift
review: Hmmm I liked this one! It was cute and flirty although I got kinda confused with what Kendall was upset about and also why her friends had their fight like that came out of nowhere…I liked the first scene and I liked the spicy scenes although why in the attic of the bookstore??? Anyways, alright read!

title: The Fantasy League
review: Phew this was so much better. I didn’t love the third act break up and there no way someone finishes five times in like thirty mins but like whatever. Overall I enjoyed! I loved the pining and the fake dating and I’m excited for the next books in the series!

title: The Silent Count
review: Yay no third act break up. I liked that he took care of her during the anxiety attack and the aftercare spicy time was so sweet. I kinda thought the thing that she held onto was kinda odd in the sense that it had been twenty years but I guess words cut deep, fun read overall!

title: The Red Zone
review: I’m happy with this series as a whole. I really liked (and idk if it was purposeful) the ladybug and lucky charm nicknames where they knew it was the other but they didn’t know how to come clean bc it felt like a nod to miraculous. I also like the dad, king just wanted his daughter treated right. Overall good book and good series!

title: Rewrite Our Story
review: I really enjoyed this book. I really didn’t feel like the blame was placed correctly at times and the mixed messages was like buddy…she did what you wanted her to do….but still it was heartbreaking and sweet. There was sm spice and I loved it and the teaser for the next book ;) anyways love a good second chance romance and the childhood friends to enemies to lovers.

title: Tempt Our Fate
review: Awww this was sweet. I thought the third act break up was silly but at least she acknowledges what and why she lashed out and to waste five million dollars bc of pure impatience???? Anyways the spice was…a lot for sure and I feel like I should re-familiarize myself with black ties and white lies lol. Overall I enjoyed!

title: Collide
review: This was fun! I think I read a little fast and skimmed so all the side characters were a blur lol; I liked the main characters although the FMC kinda annoyed me for listening to someone who clearly wasn’t someone you should get advice from and for rejecting and diminishing her relationship with the MMC. I also felt like it was slow…and kinda struggled to pick back up after taking a break, but overall not mad, not bad

title: Promise Me
review: Lol I DID enjoy this one tho. I thought the plot was moving fast but I think it also allowed there to be moments for the characters to interact and create memories together. I really like the specific moments that authors put into their books so the Oreo story and the time that they spent together watching Marvel or eating cake made their relationship more believable and made you want to root for them. Overall I liked and I sped through. Loved the strong yet learning to be vulnerable FMC; I wish I had the optimism and confidence to be like yeah I want and can go to the olympics lol. also spice

title: Good Catch
review: This one was sweet! I’m not a fan of the whole big bro being annoying bc it’s not his place imo also like….do you not trust your sis or your bff? AND the hypocrisy of him dating his sis bff. Anyways, overall I liked that they moved on from the past and were able to create a relationship and have moments unaffected by the past. I enjoyed the spice…was very informative. Overall I enjoyed!

title: Heartless
review: Wait this was so cute, save the accidental pregnancy (which ended up cute). I love that they supported, softened, and rounded each other out in the end. I like that they give each other options and respects/trusts one another to eventually come to a mutual resolution. I loved Luke and was glad he wasn’t too wise for a five year old. Overall I think this story was really sweet.

title: Flawless
review: I thought this was fun! Overall I liked but idk if there was anything to really rave. I get the whole age gap but I really don’t want the entire series to be it…like the weird teen crush part felt off and also the weirdness of her not telling him that it was a secret…whatever. Not a lot of character development and sometimes I feel like they randomly had new attributes but overall not mad.

title: Powerless
review: THIS WAS SO GOOD. I LOVE CHILDHOOD FRIENDS TO LOVERS. I also love the trust and respect that they had for one another to allow the other to make the decisions and boundaries they needed. I loved all the moments and the tension finally breaking. I REALLY enjoyed just the whole book. I think both characters helped each other to be their own person and enjoyed watching them navigate being together in new ways.

title: Reckless
review: I liked this one!!! It really started out with a bang and the MMC…DILF all the way. Honestly I loved how sweet he was and how he helped her learn to accept help and love. I think his character development was not as apparent but still loved him being DILF. Anyways…l didn’t get the whole anger thing with the paternity question but I liked that it built up to her giving into her feelings. Overall good vibes!

title: Hopeless
review: Gahh I can’t believe I finished the series! I didn’t like the last book as much…I was looking forward to Beau being all sunshiny but no he had an accident and blah blah blah. I also didn’t like Bailey she felt like a petulant child and the age gap didn’t help. Like I get she felt betrayed but she should’ve been more explicit rather than just running away. Oh well. I really enjoyed the series as a whole tho!!

title: Off to the Races
review: This one was so sweet. I thought the FMC WAS A BAD BITCH and she has my full support to whip a jackass. I love how they both show some more of their tender sides for one another and overall I loved the nuance of sacrifice and family legacy showed in the book.
