Overall I felt there was more depth and I’m really excited for the rest of this series.

title: A Photo Finish
review: I really enjoy that there is a little more depth to these books (not a lot) but enough to make me happy. I like the angst of the characters and the demons they had to face along the way. I liked that they had their own second chance and the respect and space they give one another. It was nice to see them learning to communicate and become better as individuals and as a couple. Overall fun read!

title: The Front Runner
review: AAAAH THIS WAS SO CUTE. The heart wrenching ones where I cry are always the best. I loved the nuance of these characters. I felt like they were both misunderstood or misinterpreted but were able to see each other in a really beautiful way. I think that loss and grief are really powerful themes that this book did an excellent job of weaving through and ended with the gratitude that comes hand in hand with that grief. Overall I thoroughly enjoyed!

title: A False Start
review: Huh well that happened…why does she end on the weird age gap ones? Like I get the whole change to be a better person for the other but it just felt tacky this time. I also felt like MMC was the only one to do work on the relationship during the break but whatever. Like the angst for this one felt meh…idk maybe bc I felt so much more from the last one. Anyway…happy they all got HEA

title: King of Greed
review: Hmmmm…well I liked the characters but not the plot. I felt like it tapered off near the middle and to the end. I felt all the angst at the beginning but then they tried to solve their problems with sex and that confused me. I felt like a dual timeline would’ve been a good addition because I really loved the flashbacks. I also feel iffy with the whole second chance part and the pseudo stalking. I did like how connected Dom’s personality was to the title. Overall the beginning was great and heartbreaking, but the middle to end just fell off.

title: Mile High
review: I really enjoyed this!!! I liked the characters the spice the maturity. I was worried about the third act break up not being necessary but I felt like it made sense. Maybe would’ve had the characters be a tad bit grateful considering they make millions/have family that care for them that make millions. Nonetheless I enjoyed and I’m very excited for the next one.

title: The Right Move
review: I HAVENT EVEN FINISHED GODDAMN BOOK AND IM PISSSED WHAT THE ACTAUL fork WHY IS SHE SO UPSET LITERALLY FUCKING TALK TO HIM; REMEMBER THE LAST YIME YOU ASSUMED HIS THOUGHTS…AND SHE DOESNT EVEN APOLOGIZE FOR NOT HEARING HIM OUT GIVE HIM A BREAK HES HAD FUCKING TRAUMA ABOUT BEING SET UP AND HEARING THAT YOUR PREGNANT IS KIND A BIG FUCKING DEAL…AND IM SO UPSET BC THAT ONE THING KINDA RUINED IT FOR ME (I mean clearly strong reaction) but like actually I loved the characters and plot and everything and that there didn’t seem to be a big third act break up and then you give me this shirt nuh uh. It ended happily but all that good was shadowed by one little bad and pissed me off. Like she cares about him right? But not enough to be patience with his insecurities or even talk about what made her so upset by his reaction not ducking cool anyways all that to say that I’m taking away a rating point bc of it…would’ve been a 9 but not I have to give a 8

title: Caught Up
review: Gahhhh my heart can’t take it. It was too good. I love the trope where they let each other go to live their dreams. This one hurt in the best way. I’m sad it’s over, but excited about the next. I liked the characters and how they paralleled, changed, and loved each other. I really enjoyed the parallels between Kai and Monty and eventually seeing the parallels between Monty and Millie. I felt like there was a depth and literary intention in this book which was enjoyable to read.

title: Spring Tide
review: Bro this was so bad. What a struggle to get through. I loved the idea/premise but the execution was lacking. I hate when characters have personalities/attributes that we’re supposed to know but they don’t show it in their actions so I’m like midway through a book and it’s like “oh yeah and I’m insecure bc no one takes me seriously” as a major personality trait and I’m like where did that come from (OR! When they seem like they’re really confident and then all the sudden it’s like yeah that confidence was a lie but we didn’t want to tell you the reader that) anyways I like character development not character trait bingo. Another thing about how bad this book was that the whole third act break up and reconciliation happened in like 5 pages at the end of the book which was like….? Are they middle schoolers?? Saying I like you at recess and then during lunch saying actually I don’t like you????? Anyways it was bad

title: Fix Her Up
review: Well I gotta say it was definitely a Tessa Bailey book plenty of spice but weird character development and a horrible third act break up that makes you want to tear your hair out every time. And yet I come back….honestly the weirdest part for me was the freaking clown but wtf. Also I thought the brother and sister-in-law needed more chastising bc they SUCKED and got away with it…oh well better than the two I dnfed

title: Love Her or Lose Her
review: This was better than the last but still a Bailey…ofc the third act break up was another lie of omission that wasn’t that big and actually helped her achieve her dream but whatever. I liked seeing the depth of the characters learning to better communicate what they needed and how to express their love in a way that was properly received. Overall there were elements that I thought were really well done and then the second half of the book kinda went off the rails lol (like ah yes sex fixes your problems) but whatever I liked the ending and I was glad that they didn’t actually divorce I thought the sexual tension made the second chance better and more believable. Things I’d change but not bad

title: Love Redesigned
review: AHHH this one flew by. I really appreciated NO THIRD ACT BREAK UP!!!! I loved the childhood rivals to lovers and I overall was really happy with everything. There were a few moments like dealing with problems with sex instead of talking, and Dahlia not giving Julian a chance about the biological children stuff. However they did talk which and they got better at communicating and I liked watching the vulnerable moments bc it made me want to root for them after seeing them trust one another. Overall fun read!

title: Bishop
review: I mean…definitely a mafia romance book lol. I liked the FMC until the end. The whole stunt with her going in the car when he told her not to go (like I get it but it’s like she made the situation worse) and also the big indecision about taking care of her child it was just weird…the justification and explanation for the kid being moved around is just weird….anyways over just meh didn’t really WANT to read a mafia romance but it was alright ig; gotta get those bookmarks

title: Per My Last Email
review: Wait this was actually so so cute. I loved the jimxpam vibes and no third act break up. I felt like the no spice was appropriate (I still would’ve liked it seasoned) but overall I thought this was a really sweet book. I liked the little moments and I wish we had a few more of the mundane little moments showed (not told) before the work retreat but otherwise it was a cute, fun read

title: Signed, Sealed, Delivered
review: WTF THIS WAS SO GOOD…IM SO TEMPTED TO GIVE 5 STARS. I loved the fated soulmates trope and the pen pal and the roommates and it wasn’t frustrating and they had their small moments and they didn’t have some stupid argument and they both found out at the same time and there wasn’t animosity and it was just SO perfect and sweet and lovely and I loved it hokey smokes so so so good. I understand why it’s being rec everywhere

title: Forces of Nature
review: This book started really strong and overall it wasn’t bad but the direction changed a lot without smooth transitions. I thought the first scene showing the rivalry was really strong and then the meeting ten years later was good but then transitions and aim got a little messy. I liked the characters for sure. I as the reader needed more time to be like okay now we’re in this setting or a little more backstory before throwing an important plot point at me. Overall not mad not bad

title: On Cloud Nine
review: Gahh I had so much hope for this book but it just wasn’t it. I had hope in the beginning and it just wasn’t relatable. Misunderstood rich girl who can still raise enough money to be a business owner and negotiate million dollar deals is privilege and the lovey dovey mush was just too much. I want a small bit at the end when they’re all happy but the weird lines were just bad. I was okayish with the confrontation of the parents but then again it just was a train barreling down the side of a hill. And THEN everything gets resolved with the parents in like a page or two. Overall wasn’t it…sorry

title: Love and Other Words
review: Aww I liked this one. I like the fated lovers trope and the word games. I really liked the childhood timeline I thought it was great. I didn’t live the adult one as much..I think there needed to be more moments in the present bc I get the whole you’re the only one I could ever love, but like you haven’t seen someone in 10 years and you break off a fiver year relationship no. Also she inadvertently blamed him for his father’s death….and he thought he had sex with her when really it was another girl…??? Overall I got lost in the story in a good way but there were some ??? moments.

title: The Love Plot
review: The beginning and middle were rough not gonna lie, but I liked the ending. I wasn’t a fan of the manic pixie girl vibes or the potential for a double third act break up but I think I ended up liking the end. It felt silly that different people in the family disapproved at different stages idk I guess it could’ve been a lot worse but it felt like a struggle to get through like the 55%-85% section of the book, oh well

title: Never Have I Ever
review: Hmmm I liked the beginning and moments in the middle but not all of the middle and the end was like everything was fixed with a thanos snap. I loved the teach me moments those were good. I liked there were some moments of connection but also they had the weirdest back stories and it’s hard to feel empathy for privileged rich kids

title: Spin the Bottle
review: NOT EVERYTHING BEING RESOLVED IN ONLY A FEW PAGES AND THE “YOURE LIKE A SON TO ME” EVEN THO HE DIDNT EVEN BELIEVE HIM ABOUT THE DRUG TEST AND WE HAD HARDLY SEEN THEIR RELATIONSHIP TOGETHER AND THE SAD EXCUSE OF THE MOTHER APOLOGIZING AND ALSO NOT HER SAYING SHE LOVES HIM ONLY TO SAY THAT SHE CANT TRUST HIM WTF DOES LOVING SOMEONE MEAN???? TRUSTING THEM ok ok there were some good moments (**if you say that you’re malnourishing your body to lose weight I’ll fucking lose it**) and the spice wasn’t bad either but like I can’t hang on to one off moments I need a collective of moments. Overall meh way too hyped on social media

title: Baggage Claim
review: Ok ok I really enjoyed the beginning and most of the middle. And then… :( overall it needed more relationship exposition of them liking each other, like she was feisty and then all the sudden decided “actually I really like him for no clear reason;” lying by omission is stupid, trying to justify cheating???? Suddenly all is fine and he goes to the airport??? Like she’s fine just being there??? Gahh I knew how the outcome would be but trying to justify it???? And also the eating disorder and body images weren’t great…there were many moments that I enjoyed but the few big moments that I didn’t trumped the good ones

title: Would You Rather
review: EMOTIONAL DAMAGE 3000. This book was actually so good like wtf. I liked that the the characters talked about their problems rather than ignored them. I really don’t have any substantial criticize except that I wanted more (except that it was a perfect length). I liked the nuance again of loving someone and where does the line of marriage being real cross as well as the complexity of loving someone with a chronic illness. Overall, loved it!!

title: Holiday Romance
review: Holy shirt that was an actually good one…it was like people we meet on vacation done right….and Christmas!!! I really loved that the characters talked to one another and didn’t get jaded or stupid with one fight. I like that they were mature, wanted each other to be happy, and helped each other and although there were some silly moments about getting to/through an airport in under an hour I reallly enjoyed this book. Friends to lovers was great, a few heated moments, and a sweet ending.

title: The Roommate Pact
review: There were such sweet, good moments. Overall I really enjoyed. But the third act break up timeline/pacing MADDENING (also why no spice?) They what took a month to fall in love and then took four months to even talk again??? I really liked that they did talk and there was a level is maturity and boundary setting. But cmon four months apart?? Anyways, fun read!

title: Snowed In
review: Okay she turned it around in the end. The first third was kinda rough and I wasn’t too invested but it got better and I’m glad I finished it. I like the no third act break up, liked the spice, and the talking through things. Also loved the little engagement mismatch. I wish we had more background on why she left Isaac it felt like it came out of nowhere the entire time (like hints would’ve been good) what mostly annoyed me was that the families didn’t even try to be kind to the s/o like what the heck do people really act mean like that??? Idk I guess the protectiveness is nice but still you hardly know the person and a level of politeness is courteous. Anyways a pleasant surprise and a story that got better as it went on!

title: Unsteady
review: Okay wait, that was actually so good….and I actually want sm more. I hope she keeps writing. I liked them working out their demons and learning to depend on one another without being codependent. I liked the spice and the banter and honestly was really pleased overall!

title: The Sister Between Us
review: WAIT THAT WAS SO GOOD. I felt like the second timeline felt rushed a little…just the picking up right where they left off didn’t make sense completely…but ehhh it’s fiction and they got to be happy. I liked that they all dealt with their grief and understood that space was the healthy thing to do. Ik it was supposed to be a plot twist but I ducking guessed the sister would die. I mean the title kinda gives it away but agjdnfke. Anyways it was emotional and painful but I loved it

title: Return Policy
review: I’m so disappointed. There were good moments but the bad ones outweighed them. I thought the banter was good in the beginning but then everything was solved by sex and the FMC started to annoy me. So much shirt was in this book tho like why were her family members so judge before meeting him…he hadn’t met his own family until recently. And why was she so upset about him keeping things from her like maybe he just needed time. And why was the ex such a slimy mf. Someone was clearly not doing a good job keeping him away and why did the dad blame the bf when he was trying to do right by his gf. Anyways started good and went downhill.

title: The Fake Out
review: This was good!! It’s an eight but I give it a high eight. I’m not sure what stopping the nine, but overall it was really good. I liked the no third act break up I liked the characters I like the side characters overall it was good!!! I guess there wasn’t anything bad but also nothing that really stood out lol. Still fun read!

title: Poetry of Flowers
review: Oh god this one had so much potential but you can just tell when it’s been self published and it always has some errors. Aside from typos, the poetry was cringey to me. I think I’m just not the target audience for nice words. I wanted spice and there wasn’t any :( it could’ve been so good but alas. Also what’s up with self published authors giving soooo much trauma to the characters…like developed their arcs without trauma or at least less anyways disappointed. ALSO the little insta post that got me to this book where it was like “he said the same thing to her three years later” bs bs bs freaking lied to me bc the three years later was the fucking epilogue scene and had no significance

title: Alive at Night
review: Wait shirt that was good!!! I liked the childhood rivals to lovers and I liked the vibes overall. I liked there were a lot of moments shown that built the relationship and that they were shown not said or told. The spice ;)) wow. Julian was such a good book bf. Overall I enjoyed!!!

title: Recipe for Love
review: Okay….this is going to sound horrible bc I know she has anxiety and trauma but all I could see is her being a pick me with the constant need for validation and it got old really fast. Also events would just randomly happen and I was confused like wait he did drugs?? Now he’s dead?? And like idk overall it was meh. Didn’t hate the spice but also like what was this story. I can’t decide if I want to read the next one…

title: How the Grump Saved Christmas
review: This one was good!! Yayy! I liked the friends to lovers to enemies to lovers. Honestly overall good vibes the characters weren’t annoying. They talked with one another. I also have enjoyed Kingsley books in the past so overall I liked that everyone was pretty normal and didn’t jump to conclusions and that the story was cohesive.

title: Identity
review: THIS WAS SO AWFUL. “At least I’m hot?” No. The character 180s or random bursts of new personality, the lack of continuity and random events, the hypocrisy, the self centered-ness and immaturity, literally one chapter of being broken up for what??? In the MIDDLE of the book. This book was 500 pages too long and while I can appreciate NUANCED characters, straight up annoying ones…

title: Thick As Thieves
review: Not bad! I thought the frenemies dynamic was interesting and kinda different. It felt more like snarky friends than frenemies. Anyways overall I liked. I liked the side characters and the mini plot twists but nothing really STOOD OUT. Still, it was a fun read!

title: Offside
review: Ok ok so this book started out cute and then it gets really intense….and I’m like why couldn’t we have kept it light. Like could we not have PIs and blackmailing y’all are in college for goodness sake. I felt good at the beginning and then it was like death by a thousand cuts. Drawn out, weirdly intense, and just not a fun and rom com-y, not bad but meh

title: The Deal
review: Wait that was actually good. I liked the “breakup” and I like the characters and the banter at the beginning. I thought the trauma wasn’t too overshadowing of the real story (it was at times but you still got the see good moments without it) AND the intention had been set at the beginning. Overall I really enjoyed!!

title: The Score
review: OK OK I wasn’t mad about it. I really liked the beginning. I thought it was fun the kind of serendipity of it all. I also like the kind of like groveling that happened. Overall it wasn’t bad it just didn’t stand out. A couple the side characters kind of annoyed me, but I think it did add to the characters arcs.

title: The Mistake
review: Wait, I really enjoyed that. Was it kinda cliche the whole reformed playboy yeah, but I felt like there was nuance and adversity without it being the whole plot. Also funny thought I had that there were only five more chapter so not much was going to happen right? Wrong. Still I wasn’t mad and I really liked the story overall.

title: The Goal
review: I ended up really liking this one. I know it’s technically an accidental pregnancy trope but I really liked how it was handled. I’m not sure that a man like Tucker exists but please bring one like him in my life. He was soo patient and while I was annoyed with Sabrina at times for not accepting help, I was more annoyed at the side characters who were being unsupportive. However I think that forced Tucker and Sabrina to become closer..? Anyways I really enjoyed either way

title: The Devil and the Deep Blue Sea
review: This was also sooo good I loved it. I really thought you could see the moments where the relationship grew and it was so seamless and beautiful. Honestly I don’t have really any complaints. Loved the characters and the layers and and the complexity. The duty to family again while finding your own happiness. Learning to trust others and to be vulnerable with another. Overall really enjoyed

title: A Deal With The Devil
review: Wait this was actually so good. I liked the little grumpy sunshine moment. Not sure why she hated him at first maybe just the arrogant rich prick vibe. Anyways I loved watching their tender moments and even tho they needed to communicate better their story was sweet. I also appreciated the nuances of grief and responsibility when it came to family. Kinda a minor theme but I like how it was woven in. Overall, I really liked!!

title: The Devil Gets His Due
review: I’m not ok at all this wasn’t supposed to be good. I’m not supposed to like accidental pregnancies, but crying and screaming with joy several times is a testament to the emotional roller coaster of this book. The characters journey was so beautiful and the moment where they were learning each other’s language and being there for each other in the way that the other needs was so good. What a book, what a series, I give my full approval.

title: The Devil You Know
review: Ahhh yayyy another good one. Cheese Louise I’ve liked this series. I liked again the nuance of trusting others and trusting oneself. I liked the spice (sooo good) and the enemies to lovers. Except did he ever hate her…no. Did she sometimes jump to conclusions did I totally fall for the climax and think the third act breakup was warranted yes. But also it was so good and you could understand why she made the conclusions based on her past and also see her grow to trust herself. Overall very fun!

title: Check & Mate
review: First book of the year?!!! And we’re starting off strong. Honestly Hazelwood can do no wrong in my eyes. I absolutely loved the tension pining and angst but also the tender and sweet moments (even without the spice). Loved the nerdy chess aspect and loved that the story adresses relevant content of the gender gap in the real world. The characters were awesome. They were imperfect but they did their best and grew and learned to communicate and it was so beautiful and my heart is very happy. Would love sequels on other couples, but I guess we’ll see.

title: Royally Not Ready
review: God this was so awful. I can’t with the main character. She was so immature and oblivious to the point of frustration. The third act breakup was stupid like she didn’t even hear him out but she loves him??? And he’s served the crown for over a decade and he’s tossed out like trash???? Yeah, no. The groveling was equally stupid like poetry??? Words are meaningless without action. Anyways the spice wasn’t bad but it couldn’t save this one…

title: Divine Rivals
review: FUCK ME. THIS BOOK IS SO GOOD AND NOW I HAVE TO WAIT TEN WEEKS FOR THE SEQUEL ARE YOU KIDDING ME?? The characters were cool the story was cool the enemies to lovers was rushed but the secret penpals made up for it. BUT NOW THEY HAVE TO START OVER???? I WANT TO CRY BUT I ALSO LOVED IT ARGHHH THE ANGST AND EMOTION CLEARLY IM NOT OK

title: The Long Game
review: This was like starting at the top and slowly going downhill and it’s only went faster downhill the longer it went (gaining momentum or whatever). Ok ok so 1) Cam needed more internal dialogue conflict ie. She’s so beautiful but she such a pain or I can’t stop looking at her but no he starts out seeming like he genuinely dislikes her and then 180 is like ok I’m taking care of her 2) this third act break up was some of the biggest bs. Why did she go back to a franchise/people that clearly didn’t give a rats ass abt her. He didn’t LIE bc lying implies there was a false statement made but if no statement is made then it can’t be a lie it’s simply deception. 3) no kid is that smart 4) Ada got annoying. I really wanted to like it and the beginning really wasn’t bad. But it was like decent being turned to neutral being turned to dislike

title: Midnight Kisses
review: Oh my god that was SO BAD. I’m having a hard time even giving points for smut bc even that was too much. The characters. Ok I get that people are imperfect, but these characters didn’t know how to communicate and were not healthy. I couldn’t take it. She tells him that they’re not serious and then gets mad when he doesn’t bring a flower?? I wish that the “character development” spanned longer than a condensed chapter and honestly did Greta change/learn anything??? I only feel like I got character development from Coach Sahnoun and maybe a little through Otis’ therapy journey but like….god this was bad and wayyyy too long like 500+ pages???

title: The Nice Guy
review: Wait why was this one so cute???? I actually loved how unproblematic it was. Like they discussed issues and didn’t get extreme with their reactions but there were still moments of angst and tension that were thrilling to read. Honestly quite pleased. Wouldn’t have minded a little extra seasoning but on the whole a very good read.

title: Addicted to You
review: Well…the beginning was interesting…and then it slowly spiraled like a car wreck you couldn’t look away from…I think what bothers me is that it CONTINUES FOR FIVE FUCKING BOOKS. I came for Lily and Lo thinking alrighty, but I’m already ready to move one to Connor and Rose. FIVE FUCKING BOOKS????? I’m already halfway through the second book and idk what I’m going to do.

title: Ricochet
review: Ok I really tried but I’m done. I can’t read a five hundred page book (aka the third one) to get to Rose and Connor only for them to not be together at the end. I don’t think I can finish this series. I mean 10 FREAKING BOOKS???? Maybe one day when I need something trashy to read. This was a 265 page collection of words that took the plot nowhere and the characters maybe an inch; yeah I think I’m done

title: Made to Rule
review: Ahhhhh I’m not ok. Ok ok. Overall really got into it. I was less enraptured at this one (maybe readers fatigue or that I stayed up hella late on the one before) but I still feel like it tied almost all the loose ends. We see Katie as a master of all magics and the kingdom brought to balance AND we see her and Lowell (bc I’m a romance girlie at heart). Honestly love the side characters tho and I get why we wanted to build Archer to only tear him down…he maybe needed more delulu traits to begin with but it is Katie’s pov and she DID think she loved him so…really enjoyed the series as a whole

title: Made to Conquer
review: Well darn. Really loved the side character development but I have some arguments…why let the prince be built up as a love interest also he ends up being manipulated and he cares but in the wrong way and then she’s like ahhh actually I like this were-guy which like fair bc he takes care of her rather than her taking care of him but I think I needed more comparisons. Also ig now the prince is a villain so yayy. I liked learning more about the worlds and honestly I’m not mad but once I see a couple together that’s the one that sticks so re learning can be a pain but Lowell is def better for her. Ok fun magic a little spice and another cliffyy lol

title: Made from Magic
review: Well shoot that was good!!! I like how it’s unclear who’s good and who’s bad. Morally greyyyy such a good color. Not a fan of the potential love triangle bc obvi I’m here for the romance but overall what the heck it’s good!! Onto the next!!!

title: Of Ice and Heartbreak
review: I enjoyed this novella!! Gotta love Edina and I’m so excited to see where her story takes us!! AHHHHH. I like series but I love stand-alones that create a series. Honestly thought it was going to cliffhanger but nope!!! HEA!! I’m sooo excited for Puck’s story it’s going to be awesome. I’m so glad that Edina got her own book (I think we need a book for Adrianna but that’s just me). Loved the characters and the plot and the world building overall good vibes and it answered questions from the Made From Magic series as well. The slow burn pinky touching !!!!!!!! Gotta love romances and honestly digging the romantasy

title: Garnet Flats
review: I am disappointed. Was on a good streak but I think Talia’s second chance romance deserved better. One I get Foster was manipulated but also idk if I could forgive. And we didn’t see moments of WHY they should be together just this innate connection bs. There were a few moments where they leaned on one another but it’s wasn’t enough. We needed flashbacks of them building the relationship not just oh I’m horny. Listen I love some good smut ok? but like it doesn’t win over a relationship communication does. Also he basically has a kid with her former bff (Vivienne) who is also cuckoo bc SHE wants Foster to lose a game bc her bf is in millions of debt. Like the bff made mistakes and has to pay for the consequences (I think Foster also made mistakes but at least made an effort to put it behind him) But Vivienne asks him to re-insert himself into it??? I really feel like Tally deserved so much better. I think trying to maintain whatever bs relationship w Vivienne bc of the kid really threw it over the edge for me.

title: Indigo Ridge
review: Wait that was so good. I was on edge the entire time. That prologue sooo good and creepy. I was proud of myself for kinda guessing who. I also really loved the characters and the relationship and the side characters. Too scared to fall asleep so I read in one sitting lol. But seriously the mystery plus romance equal *chef’s kiss* Really good read and excited for the next!

title: Juniper Hill
review: I enjoyed this one too. God I love when the characters aren’t too problematic like yess I absolutely want to read about you talking and working through your problems. Loved the tension, loved seeing Memphis become more confident and ask for help, loved seeing them pursue their dreams. Kind wanted more hints at the kidnapping to add a little edge, but overall I really enjoyed

title: Jasper Vale
review: OK this is so much better than the one before but still kinda meh. I really enjoyed the characters. I was kind of annoyed with the Eden family, mainly the parents. I think that Jasper had a point that her parents didn’t seem to show that they trusted Eloise and I wish that had been dealt with. I think the whole mom forcing her to hire an employee and not follow the same process and then to have that employee almost shoot Eloise was a major plot point and needed to be discussed for the parent-child relationship. I liked that Eloise and Jasper had a few tender moments together and that it kinda evolved from sex. Overall I enjoyed!

title: Sable Peak
review: I wasn’t originally a fan or Vera and Mateo together bc of her relationship to Vance (niece to sister-in-law??) but the story wasn’t bad. I didn’t feel much in anyway. Like there were cringe moments and nice moments but no strong feelings either way. Mateos unwavering support was adorable, but definitely risky to be housing a fugitive. Overall ehh

title: Crimson River
review: Gosh I liked it but it also felt unsatisfying. I liked the mystery and I liked the relationship. I liked how the third act break up played out (I feel icky about lying but idk I’m not them). The “Where’s my chair Blue?” internally sobbing. I didn’t feel as scared with this one. Vance def was a little obsessed but again he had his reasons. I feel like the unsettled part of me is going to be the part I remember and enjoy

title: Someone You Love
review: Well that was something. It wasn’t bad but it wasn’t good. Like I feel like every conversation was trying to be deep which I get but it made me bored. I also just am not a fan of the over-mushy words more of a fan of actions. I was kinda over the self pitying from both main characters at the end and why was Bea killed off??

title: Meet Again
review: It was cute but so dumb. They literally wouldn’t talk about the root of the issue of why they broke up the first time until it came to a bottleneck and they had a mini breakup a second time which somehow was so easily smoothed over and moved on from which makes it confusing why they didn’t get back together sooner. Also they never resolved the parents making her buy higher. Wasn’t a fan of the many words of lovey doveyness and I really think a dual timeline would’ve been fun. Honestly I was kinda bored. The beginning wasn’t bad with the feelings but then the whole limbo was like also a limbo of feels which was boring. It’s like they were trying to be unproblematic but we’re still problematic and boring on top of it; so many ways to say I was bored lol

title: Meet Fake
review: This was also kinda dumb. I kinda just want Ellie’s story. This one kinda gave codependency at the end. Why didn’t Sage trust Tristan’s word abt his parents like???? Also bro was so dramatic in the third act break up it was comical. The main characters were too good of people in like a cringey way. Like wanting to help people yes it’s good but do it in small ways that make me believe you. The proposal in the epilogue was cute. There were moments but it was mostly cringe.

title: Meet Hate
review: What the actual fuck. I suffer through two dumb books and then you give me this piece of gold???? How dare you Abi Sabina. Holding out???? It was shorter but the enemies to lovers was beautifully played out with wit and banter and jokes and sass and just soooo good. The farm girl personality was balanced and while the kid sometimes said a few things that were too perceptive it was happy and fun there was sacrifice and growth and the slow burn. So good it was too short honestly and I’m mad that I had to wait this fucking long for it. Two fucking books to get to this magnificent, endearing story. I’m just glad I held out. I considered not reading but I knew Ellie would be the best heroine. Anyways I loved and literally read in one evening like I started not even 3 hours ago. And I took a shower in between and still finished in one night, overall loved it

title: Snap Shot
review: 100 pages too long, not enough moments, why do they like each other? Liked the beginning with the hating and tension but then fell off. Also I’m beginning to not like when one person makes all the rules like let it be a mutual decision…so dumb marriage is a social construct so obvi it means different things to different ppl but I’m def in the category that you don’t have to be married to be in a committed loving relationship like…also there was so much smut which I was expecting and wanted but also…yep those are the thoughts

title: Anatomy: A Love Story
review: AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH I HAVE NO WORDS. I’m so freaked out right now. It is NOT SPOOOKY SEASON. But damn this book was spooky. I loved it tho. I loved the slow burn romance and I can only imagine how it’s all going to turn out. SPOILER: Sir is immortal????? So much to unpack. The dissecting and gore was eugh but the heroine was so determined and caring and so cool. Then the mystery undercurrent of people’s organs being taken???? So good. I’m so on edge and kinda scared to go to bed

title: Strictly Not Yours
review: Yayy this one was sweet, I was a little unhappy with the third act break up but I liked the sisters defense and how they made up. It’s just the stupid lying by omission thing bothers. ITS NOT A forkING LIE. ITS DECEPTION. If someone made a case like, why didn’t you trust me with the truth, then I’ll accept it. Or why didn’t you trust me enough to be honest and not deceive me. But the beginning was good and honestly it all got resolved in the end so…gotta love a sweet rom com HEA with a little seasoning ;)

title: Immortality
review: So creepy gives me the heebeejeebees but it felt less gruesome than the first but maybe I got used to it. I mean he slashed the body to bits and I…I’d say hardly flinch but let’s be real I definitely fully recoiled. I wasn’t really feeling the “will they won’t they” vibes with Jack and Hazel but whatever. I’m glad they got their happy ending. I’m still confused about the immortality stuff like….her head is still alive?? Does she eat?? I loved the plot twist with the princess both the being “sick” and also finding out who her true love is. I felt like there was less direction in this book than the first (mainly bc the first one was hazel wanting to be a surgeon and this one was her figuring out what she even wanted to do at this point) ehhh I tried something different and it’s not my thing

title: The Summer We Fell
review: Omg there was so much angst. Miss girl got manipulated by everyone except Luke. It was so complex and nuanced. The writing was very well done and the emotions were pouring over every page. I wish there wasn’t cheating, and I wish Danny had come to the realization that he was taking advantage of Juliet and diminishing her vitality but he was too much of an ego centric confused Christian boy. I’m glad Donna came to her senses tho. Also why was there no penance for the pastor that guy was a dick not only to Juliet but also his wife taking advantage of his family?? I want to criticize Juliet for letting people have power over her, but if you’re fed your entire life that you’re less than with unsafe people, then it makes sense why she would cling to something that felt stable. (Also that would be like blaming the victim so…) Anyway the moments with Juliet and Luke has so much tension and when it burst it was like an explosion in the best way. I both loved and hated the story so so much

title: Ruthless Vows
review: Lol only was five weeks but damn it it was good! I won’t lie I lose some investment near the end bc the plot wasn’t all that clear; I felt like actually killing Dacre was anti climatic and the last ditch effort to make the ending interesting with Roman being accused was also kinda dumb. But! the tension at the beginning with the letters and secrecy *chefs kiss* and when Roman and Iris see each other in person by chance and in secret…so good. Loved the little side love stories too. Tobias and Attie were too cute. I loved all the throwbacks to the first book and I was happy with the story/ending overall

title: The Fake Mate
review: WAIT A FUCKING MOMENT. That was actually so good. Loved the werewolf vibes; honestly was really happy with how the third act break up went and how it was Mackenzie to scold and talk about being upset that he didn’t trust her. Truly so good there were cute moments, a bit of grumpyxsunshine, a few running jokes, fun meddling family members all in all i loved it. Plus some the lines were really good “he looked at me like I told him the sky was made of chees?”” Gold.

title: Bride
review: It was good but lowkey was halfway lucid reading most of it in the middle of the night lol. I liked the mystery and seeing this version of werewolf and vampires. It’s always a different set of rules with like similar guidelines but the minutiae is different. I liked the twists and the characters it wasn’t punch you in the gut amazing but it wasn’t bad at all. Solid read, thoroughly enjoyed. Lol a life time of Misery.

title: Too Much
review: Ok I have some thoughts these men are kinda toxic. Like needlessly berating the woman instead of being supportive. Assuming all the fucking time—like the reason Thalia didn’t tell Theo was bc she was obvi scared of his reaction and his reaction proved her right. Also why does he get away with like leaving her alone after being vulnerable and why does she get away with murder. Idk what the hell was going on but I’m hoping the next characters are better…not holding my breath ok there were some meh moments but like..idk

title: Too Wrong
review: Alright I’m done. Somehow they got more toxic. Poor Cassidy was looking for some validation which she should look in herself, but instead trusts a jerk who repeatedly hurts her. Hmmmm what does that sound like? oh yeah a manipulative, toxic relationship. Logan is so hot and cold and unpredictable he says one thing, expects another, but then does something entirely different. He got better in the end when they established a relationship (when he actually defends her) but still he sucked most of the book and never seemed to really see her as a person and more as a dirty secret. Also the fucking assuming didn’t get any better. Logan assumed his brothers thought one thing, assumed that Cassidy wanted something, so much assuming that was wrong and hurtful. He also “picked his brothers first” when in reality he never even gave Cassidy a chance to explain herself—so much wrong with the book but the spice was angsty…but yeah overall kinda sucked. Although more direction than the first I’d say.

title: Ten Trends to Seduce Your Best Friend
review: Okay that was pretty bad…but a different kind of bad where they couldn’t communicate until the last 50 pages of the book. The characters really made 180 personality switches on a whim and assumed all the time. They both have traumatic pasts that aren’t even divulged to explain why they are they way they are. Honestly the whole concept had me lost and I wasn’t all that invested in the characters or the story.

title: Forever After All
review: Lol what just happened. It wasn’t awful but was it great? No. Alec bordered the line of being toxic but in the end I think had good intentions. Honestly things were so fast paced and yet slow at the same time. Also Elena was like it’s revenge time and *explosion* which I guess shows character development from her desperation at the beginning. I feel ehh about it. Not awful not great, slightly problematic but better than that one series I started

title: Haunted Hearts
review: Ok honestly I’m not that mad. It wasn’t the best writing and sometimes the characters were unpredictable and confusing but I think it ended up being negligible for the most part. I liked the times where there was communication and while it was a lot of trauma I felt like there were some real genuine moments. Okay I’m not mad and it could’ve been a lot worse

title: Guilty Minds
review: I was not expecting a full on bully romance. I’m so fucking mad now. They literally excuse everything. Her friends and family fucking encourage Kayla to give Justin, her forking bully (which if they truly cared why not see that he bullies her and fucking address it? why force her to spend time with him?) who has basically emotionally abused her, manipulated her, stalked her as young as nineteen and now he gets to have her?? I refuse to believe he even sees her as a person. No. This is not okay. I have no words to describe how fucked up this book is

title: Twice in a Blue Moon
review: That was so good!! How dare they cut it off. How dare they?!? I was enraptured and captivated by this story. I loved the nuance and angst from the past. I was shocked at how Sam sold Tate out but I liked how it all played out and I felt like I could still root for him. The “I hate that I want him,” the supportive bff, the supportive co star and director, honestly I’m here for all of it. I loved this book and it was simply cruel to end it where they did but I like being able to imagine that they wrote a new movie about their love story and that the book in it of itself is that…so meta.

title: The Seven Year Slip
review: What the heck that was so good. Okay but the timeline thing was confusing but also like WHY WAS IT SO GOOD. I loved that there were moments of Clementine and Iwan intertwined at different times in their lives and that it was a story about finding yourself beyond what others think and reconciling the person you were and are. I loved that they helped remind each other of themselves and it was honestly just so good. Characters check, well written, interesting plot, overall it was such a fun and interesting read

title: Lightlark
review: God this book took forever. Okay let’s start off with the positives bc there’s only a few. I’ll give the author the good plot twist/kinda climax I liked that Celeste turned on Isla and that we find out the true nature bc honestly I was confused the whole time abt what the hell was happening. I also gotta give credit for the world building and creativity. But now, WHAT THE fork WAS THAT. you’re telling me she had powers this entire time???? Why the fork were we hearing her sulk about being powerless and feeling sorry for herself when she also literally have two power rulers curled around her finger and could’ve used THEIR power. She WAS selfish even tho the person she should’ve been caring towards ended up being the villain but whatever. The fucking love triangle grates my nerves what the hell is going on there???? She had a whole fucking relationship with Grim??? And he took her memories why??? And he didn’t tell her she had powers why??? And he was in love with her too??? And then we have Oro who where did he come from?? And wasn’t he old?? Like he was dying so in my mind he’s fucking old bc I guess Isla and Oro love each other so they can use each other’s powers???? I feel like they deserve each other tho because they’re both kinda lame and they did spend actual time together but then I also think that maybe Oro deserves better??? I’m not sure. I think Grim deserves somewhat better tho. Yes the memory removal and yes not telling powers doesn’t make fucking sense but the other stuff was out of trying to protect her, was it misguided yes, did she really need to go love another man for it?? Was her love for Oro just payback for Grim’s betrayal???? Honestly I just don’t care enough to read the next one. It’s going to be a bad love triangle and honestly I just wanted a slow burn romance with a morally gray guy but no she goes for the powerful sun king. SHE HAS FUCKING HISTORY WITH GRIM. And there’s still unresolved conflict between realms which just confuses me. No way I’m slumming through the next book I plan on watching a YouTube video.

title: Pretty Rings and Broken Things
review: This was fun! I was only kinda annoyed with Winnie and Archer some of the time for not just communicating but I liked how things played out. Also the Winnie being a designer felt like it should’ve been hit on a little earlier on or a bit more clearly. I liked the spice, I like the tension and build up. Overall it was what I was expecting a little mushy at times but overall not bad.

title: The Dead Romantics
review: I fucking knew he was alive. Poston was too adamant in her writing that she gave it away plus the clues and the fact that he was the love interest. Anyways it was good…there were a lot of somewhat boring/slow moments but I feel like that was the vibe of the book. I liked the premise of the story. I liked the FMC, Florence, when she wasn’t avoiding her problems and sulking and I wish there was more of Benji. But overall I enjoyed, and I like how they find each other and match each other like puzzle pieces. I also think there’s an overall message about grief and change that’s sweet but a little mushy so I didn’t read into it too much (lol)

title: Rock And A Hard Place
review: This was dumb. The reason they broke up was dumb, the fact they were apart for seven years was dumb, the reason why they were forced together again (a fucking carnival??) dumb. I think my rants to Rachel summarize my thoughts: NOT THE FUCKING MISCOMMUNICATION TROPE FOR A MARRIAGE AND THEM TO GET BACK TOGETHER SEVEN YEARS LATER. ALL SHE HAD TO DO WAS EXPRESS HER CONCERNS AND HAVE A DAM CONVERSATION WITH HIM JEEEESSUS. AND ITS NOT FAIR TO PUT THE BLAME ON ONE PERSON KIEK THEY BOTH DUCKED UP AND WHY IS IT THE MOM SHOWING HIM THE LIGHT THE STORY WOULD HAVE SO MUCH MORE IMPACT IF THEY TALKED THROUGH IT AND SHOWED CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT. I thought it was kinda cute but overall dumb and would’ve been more impactful if we had seen them struggling and almost falling out of love and only to stay in love before they even got a divorce bc it was hard to read while knowing there was a divorce but not knowing why

title: Whisky Business
review: I liked this one but it fell off at the end. It was a decent read I liked the characters and the banter and the supportive siblings and spice; they really needed to communicate a little more. I liked when they had the moment of realization when they needed to give each other the benefit of the doubt, but then they also kept assuming what the other person would do and it was just silly. Overall, not bad

title: Josh and Hazel's Guide to Not Dating
review: Okay overall, I liked this book. I’m usually not a huge fan of the overly quirky characters, but I didn’t mind Hazel and I liked that Josh accepted her. The accidental pregnancy…yeah, but the slow burn and the friends to lovers were good (although they always gave more than friends vibes) like I said overall not bad.

title: Of Stormlarks and Silence
review: Wait why was this book actually so good. I loved the mystery and the unraveling or history. The “enemies” to lovers the betrayals oh my gosh I really enjoyed overall. I likes the magic and the royalty and the like I shouldn’t like this person but I do. All the vibes were really hitting. Again I had so much fun with this book

title: Of Chaos and Cadence
review: Ehhh this was alright I guess. The previous one was just so enrapturing and this one fell kinda flat in comparison. I didn’t feel like there were a lot of moments between just Liam and Isa and like I wasn’t invested in the story overall….there wasn’t anything that stood out as bad but nothing that really stood out as good/great either

title: Butcher & Blackbird
review: That was really messed up but I loved it. Apart from the scenes, with the ice cream and cannibalism this was really manageable. Sloane and Rowan were so wonderful to read about and I really rooted for them. I loved the moments they shared and how they matched each other’s energy and I liked the message of finding someone who accepts and loves you for you. Overall I’m very pleased with this read but don’t think I could stomach ice cream in a while.

title: Running into You
review: I feel meh about this one. I wasn’t really invested in Betty and Josh but I didn’t mind it overall. I just felt lukewarm about all of it. I liked the side characters and I’m excited for the next book. (Spice was good) But again, not bad, not great

title: Until You
review: This wasn’t bad. I kinda was upset at the whole self fulfilling prophecy stuff. Grayson was all like “Aria is going to leave me bc I’m a monster” which causes him to draw away and sulk which causes her to draw away fulfilling what he said would happen. Also idk how I felt about her projecting her insecurities onto him at the end there like they both need therapy not just him let’s take a moment to acknowledge both characters’ humanity. Anyways it was a fine read either way

title: Raise the Bar
review: I think I liked this better than the first one, but it was still overall meh. I liked that there was more tension, but also learning of communication. I always have mixed feelings about characters who hold the world on their shoulders. Part of me feels like “be fucking humble and ask for help” and part of me feels bad for them, but it depends on how they’re written. There were some nice moments and they learned from one another but overall it was not bad, not great

title: Professor Astor
review: Ok I have a bone to pick. I get traditionalism but also like why did Leia’s parents have to disapprove so thoroughly like I just couldn’t put myself in their shoes. ALSO the real bone to pick is that you can have children that aren’t biological but that doesn’t make them “not your children.” i think that one particularly pissed me off bc there are plenty of ways to become a parent and not all of them have to be natural. Honestly this book was so good with the children and nuance with the exception of those to points but the biological parent and the not giving the blessing thing really pisses me off so I’m docking a point from the rating

title: Bittersweet Memories
review: This fucking book. Beginning: invested. Middle: enraged. End: invested. Dude the roller coaster ride that was this book. Ok ok so basically everyone in the middle sucked. I can’t victim blame bc it’s not Alanna’s fault for losing her memory and people feeding lies, but everyone else kinda sucked and it was hard to read when it felt like they were taking advantage in an icky way. I liked seeing Silas and Alanna’s relationship when they were both conscious of everything including the past. The beginning and end were gold. But the middle was fucking agony. HOWEVER the book ends are what I’m left remembering and I really liked how it ended so

title: Dr. Grant
review: I wasn’t ready for the plot twist but I did guess it before it was really revealed. Honestly I feel conflicted. I liked it but also there were things that were like ehhhh idk about that mainly that their families didn’t tell Noah and Amara the truth at the beginning like cmon. It was SPICY which is great. I just feel conflicted about the tension it was good but it was also dumb at times and the random assumptions that would last like ten pages lol anyways not bad overall

title: I Hope This Doesn't Find You
review: Awwww wait I really liked this one. The tension and the stolen glances. The rivalry to lovers so good. Obviously they’re in school so I don’t think there should be declarations of love or whatever but that’s YA for ya. Honestly I wished there was a little more conclusion. I felt like we got Sadie’s character growth but not so much of Julius. Still I enjoyed overall

title: Of Vines and Rivals
review: Okay I liked this book. It was a pretty quick read for me. I think I might have been able to enjoy it more had I read it with the other books. I think because I was away from this realm the impact of it was lessened. I liked the story I liked the ending and the characters and side characters. I don’t think I was as invested in Puck and Lysandra as I was with Edina/Eldoris or Katie/Lowell, but it was still a fun story.

title: Not My Romeo
review: Ok I hate to say this but oh my god Elena was so annoying. I don’t think there was enough recognition of the trauma that Jack went through that lead to his mistrust of people. Like it was so annoying that she thought she should just “be the one” and bc of that he should trust her like no he’s is completely justified in not trusting relationships—it killed his mom, and almost ruined his career and then rather than being understanding Elena’s all “me me me” I really hated all the side characters specifically Elena’s family bc it’s clear she doesn’t trust them and that was also hypocritical. She wouldn’t even tell them the truth about how her sister and ex cheated on her to “protect” their family when in reality she just didn’t trust their reaction. Honestly this was dumb and it only went downhill.

title: To Con a Gentleman
review: Wait stop. That was so good. I loved that so much. I wish we had been able to see the fruit of Rose and Carver’s relationship change, but the story was so good. I really vibed with the regency era and there were so many cute/funny moments. Plus the con woman x noble man was actually such a good trope. I really enjoyed that Rose was such a strong protagonist. I liked seeing them learn to trust each other and become more vulnerable and also help each other mend old wounds. Honestly this was such a fun book!

title: To Catch A Suitor
review: That was like so slow burn. But gahhhh I’m so upset. Why do authors think it’s cute that the wrong couple gets to the fucking wedding? It’s not. If the real couple were supposed to be together they would have already known wayyy beforehand and should’ve gotten their shirt together wayy beforehand. I’m actually so upset because this book was so good and filled with MOMENTS that were perfect and you could see the relationship and how they knew each other and it was beautiful but then the ending had to fucking ruin it. Like I’m good with calling off an engagement but a whole fucking wedding is leading someone on to a different level and imo not cool. Anyways it was good but I’m mad at the last chapter or two.

title: The Nanny
review: I really enjoyed this one lol. I was worried the OnlyFans part would be weird but it was kept to a minimum and while I can’t say it makes sense, it made some sense. I didn’t mind the third act break up and I really liked seeing the whole family grow together. I enjoyed the spice and honestly the whole read was pretty fun!

title: Off the Grid
review: Wait that was actually so fun. I loved Camilla and Riggs and I liked that Camilla was strong in her own way and learned to be vulnerable and let others strengthen her. I liked the way that Riggs created a safe space for her to let her become more secure that didn’t feel like words on paper. I liked the little enemies to lovers and the spice and NO THIRD ACT BREAK UP all around I had good vibes for this book!

title: The Roommate Situation
review: I can’t describe how awful this was to read. Jess is so so whiny and insecure and Conor just LOVES her which is fine, but he can’t just validate everything; she needs to find the confidence herself. I want a strong FMC not one who’s so insecure and projects her fears without apologizing. And also she’s supposed to be quirky and artsy which in this was just annoying. This book also was trying soooo hard to be good and it was so far off the mark for me.

title: On The Edge
review: Bro why tho. Cruz and Maddix were so….mixed messages like I think the author was going for complex characters but I was just confused. Also the third act breakup pitiful pathetic like girl don’t beg for a guy to choose you. And then to have him figure it out in five seconds several weeks later….and then she was happy to have him back like that *snap* idk it was bad but it wasn’t great. I think the pressures they characters got added something interesting but overall…ehh

title: Managed
review: Aww I liked that one better. Gabriel and Sophie were cute and loved their meet cute. The little third act shirt show was a tad annoying bc she just made an assumption instead of talking with him, but ig it makes sense why should she trust him if he doesn’t trust her. Anyway the slow burn was good and I liked that they learned to be a bit more vulnerable with one another and Gabriel to be more vulnerable with the group.

title: Idol
review: Well that was kinda fun. I can’t say I loved the third act breakup but I thought the whole of the story was good. I liked Libby and Killian, but I think they needed to communicate a little more at the end. I liked the side characters too. I don’t think this was bad per se but it didn’t really strike me.

title: Fall
review: That was really sweet. I think their story was really beautiful. I didn’t want a third act break up but the moment with Killian and John reconciling was really sweet and needed. I wish there was something to show that John kept his word and learned to not push her away but I think that the way they learned to be more trusting was a beautiful journey and a joy to read. The meet cute was really fun, the banter, and the slow burn all made the story a very fun read! I also really loved the footnotes from the author

title: Exposed
review: Hmmm well I liked and also disliked. I didn’t like how they assumed what the other was feeling rather than just talking and that was basically the whole premise of the book. I wanted to like Brenna more, but I didn’t…I wanted more vulnerable moments between them and also trying to justify the aunt kissing and taking advantage of a Rye wasn’t it. It was fun to see the characters from the previous books and overall it wasn’t bad but I just wasn’t super invested in Brenna and Rye.

title: The Things We Leave Unfinished
review: I AM NOT OKAY HOW DARE REBECCA YARROS RIP MY HEART OUT LIKE THAT UNACCEPTABLE. Truly I am in shock. I really was not expecting the plot twist and for that I give high marks. I wasn’t super clear on the whole owning movie rights thing but this story was infused with grief tragedy lies but also determination perseverances and love. Honestly I loved the characters. I was kinda annoyed with Georgia and her mother’s relationship but I know it was a point of growth for her. Anyways…I need to reel for a little bit

title: The Bodyguard
review: That was pretty fun! When they first met and really the first chunk of the book I wasn’t enjoying the fangirling but after Hannah got over that and once we saw her be more of a badass I enjoyed. Girl knows how to keep a grudge tho. Jack was definitely a man written by a woman, easygoing, not emotionally stilted, obviously super hot. But whatever there were parts of the book where I was like this is actually a reality tv show moment. But I liked that it didn’t take itself too seriously while also infusing some self love and mental health messages. I liked the characters and their banter and Glen’s sadism and revenge. Overall it was a fun book and no third act break up!!!

title: King of Sloth
review: I actually kinda loved this. By far my favorite King of Sin book. I really liked Xavier’s and Sloane’s characters. I feel like we got to see them in one context and then see how they started to view each other differently. However my favorite part of it all was how honest it all was (well mostly). I felt like their communication, other than that third act temporary separation can’t really call it a break up since Xavier was persistent, was very transparent and I thought that was refreshing. They didn’t assume, they tried to be there for one another, they had humility when they made mistakes truly likable characters that you want to root for. There were a few moments where I was like hmmm I wish this was shown not told, but on the whole there are a lot of sweet moments that show the development of their relationship that weave together nicely. Also I can’t explain why but I really love the goldfish. I think it’s perfect and I can’t explain why.

title: The Déjà Glitch
review: Bro I liked this book except the main character. I thought that Gemma was privileged and obnoxious. Was she burned a couple of times? Yes. However didn’t Jack also have baggage? And did he act like an entitled prick? No. Ok I get that this story was about getting out of the loop and not just going through the motions of life. I would’ve like this book better had we been given say like 5 days of repeats and dual pov. I was so sick of Gemma’s whiny perspective and I wanted to hear Jack’s. I also don’t understand what got them out of the loop was it seriously the falling in love?? Or was it that they changed their careers/life courses?? I think this had such an opportunity but fell flat. I also had a hard time not comparing it to “The Map of Tiny Perfect Things” which I felt made more sense for a loop and the impact was better.

title: We Can't Keep Meeting Like This
review: Was it bad? No. Was Quinn really annoying but you also understood her kind of?? Yes. Like I feel like I got her fear but I was still like just communicate and the family was infuriating. Honestly I’m with Quinn that the small gestures are the best. A freaking homemade mug cake?!?! C’mon. Anyways was really confused me was all the freaking acronyms there were so many and I wasn’t quite sure what half of them were. Overall I enjoyed this story. I liked Tarek and in the end I didn’t mind Quinn. I liked their conflicting thoughts about love and showing affection and some of the other stuff made their story look good soo..yeah

title: Funny Story
review: Ok ok i really liked this until a certain point like 75% of the way. The last quarter of the book was like new weird confusing drama that detracted from the beginning of the story. I thought Daphne was so relatable in her reading and awkward introverted ways. I loved Miles and his big heart. But what was that third act conflict?? Bc it isn’t that there’s a bad explanation it’s that there isn’t an explanation. I thought the dates were cute and the tension building was fun and it came to a precipice and crashed in a good way but then there was fall out that led to some random drama that didn’t make sense and could’ve been solved with a good conversation.

title: The Cruel Prince
review: Idk what I just read but it took ducking forever. In the beginning I found Jude to be plain annoying…then the plot picked up and now we’re at the point where I don’t really care for any of the characters. Yippee. Also why did Jude pretend to care about mortal servants for like a few pages (but then the servant died but then she undies and is a merperson??) I didn’t hate the plot it wasn’t actually too bad to follow which is good but now Jude is just winging it which ehh…Honestly this book was well written I just don’t if I really cared for it. I think I wanted more romance but instead I got plot but not “plot” :(

title: To Have and to Hoax
review: Bro this book made me so mad. The main characters were annoying as shirt and the whole ducking plot is a series of miscommunication that could’ve been solved with a clear conversation. Even the side characters were saying “Just talk to one another” but no they pulled stupid pranks which were dumb in more ways than one. The real kicker is that it’s all James’s fault AS IF VIOLET HAS DONE NOTHING WRONG. Girl….how you be expecting him to read your mind?? How did you think that faking an illness would make you feel better?? Like her “pranks” were actually so obvious it was insulting his intelligence. I really think that if they had been honest about the hurt they inflicted on one another from the beginning this book would’ve been the correct length of just the prologue.

title: To Love and to Loathe
review: You know what? This ended up being pretty good. I liked the characters and while there was one scene I was frustrated with out of the whole book…not bad. I liked that Jeremy and Diana talked to each other (even tho that one convo wasn’t effective) and I liked the stolen moments in secret. I liked the honesty and I liked that we got to know the characters better after having seen them in the previous book. I also really enjoyed some of the side characters namely Lady Helen and Emily

title: To Marry and to Meddle
review: All’s well that ends well but Julian was a dick and then he had an epiphany that he loved Emily and that was the book! I didn’t feel like there were moments together that felt fluid. Like the whole point of arranged marriage is that they secretly like one another and especially since they’d been friends prior one would think that the author would make their affection more apparent. But while they were denying how they feel I was feeling like yeah I believe that you don’t love them. Ok ok but they shouldn’t have teased the friendship in prior books if they come to the marriage hardly as friends. AND my biggest problem is that Julian was constantly dismissing Emily’s ideas. The last maybe chapter or two was cute but didn’t have the same effect as it could’ve had the beginning been better.

title: Wild Love
review: Stop that was actually really good. Not a fan of the dumb third act break up bc I think she overreacted just a tad but overall I absolutely loved the tension and buildup. I thought that Cora was way too smart at the beginning but it seems like she got to grow into only having to be a child. Some of the lines were cheesy but had me banging my fist for more. Overall I enjoyed and it felt like a catalyst to read some more!

title: Our Secret Moments
review: I have been in a SLUMP. Honestly this book was okay. I really don’t get why sibling get upset when their sibling is dating their bff like I get the you used to hang out with me thing but also now this person is your sister/bro irl. Gotta love the BIPOC representation tho!! I like how devoted they were the entire book but there were parts that felt mushy that just made me jealous and sad (I want a bf who buys me books and cuddles). I do think that there was personal growth but some it felt forced and sometimes I just wasn’t captivated. I think it’s a me problem tho that I’m having a hard time getting into books..

title: Our Secret Game
review: Ehhh finished the book but wasn’t really feeling it. I kinda felt like Nora took Wes for granted and I truly don’t understand how people are not attracted to their girl/boy bff. I really also felt meh about their challenges. I felt for Wes and his parents divorce but Nora just felt like white pretty privilege oh no I’m not going to be an actress. Which statistically speaking “making it” is very improbable. There were ALOT of mushy parts which I found boring rather than cute. I just felt like if he’d been in love with her all the time and there had been evidence how had she been so blind…ehh good spice at the end tho

title: Ninth House
review: You know I ended up enjoying it. It was a little hard to get into because of all the exposition but overall it was fun. I was not expecting Alex to have so much trauma and honestly a lot of the book I tried not to read too closely or else I’d get lost in the words. I wish there was more foreshadowing of who was culpable but maybe North was supposed to be that. Still proud of myself for reading off genre and I really want to know what happened to Darlington.

title: Hell Bent
review: I’m invested in this series. To be frank, I was scared. I read this mostly at night and I was on edge lol. So much happened as far as plot goes but I really enjoyed. I found it a little easier to read than the first because there was more plot and I already was familiar with the world. BUT that did not stop Bardugo from adding a new world to build :( jk I had a lot of fun and I’m glad Darlington is back. I think I’m mainly confused about Mercy’s reaction bc what did girly think she was signing herself up for?

title: Love Unwritten
review: Apart from how hot and cold Rafa was at the beginning, this book was really sweet. Sometimes Nico was too smart and sometimes Rafa would lash out and I wasn’t expecting it, but I liked how Ellie would push back and self advocate. NO THIRD ACT BREAK UP WOOOOO. I’m honestly surprised how quickly I got through this one considering how long it is. I think there were good moments of communication about trust and insecurity that showed the development of the relationship that was fun to read.

title: Not in Love
review: My one thing that bothered me was that she made Rue not competent. Like I understand that she’s talented but I think that needed to be played up more and not have it be like Eli or Nyota fixing things. I think like having more about her patent or science would’ve been better. However I adored seeing her and become more apt in social situations and in my eyes Ali Hazelwood can do no wrong. I loved the spice and just the acceptance that Eli and Rue showed each other. Anyways I enjoyed it!!

title: Second Chance Mates
review: You know what? In the end it was good. Like so much of the plot was shoved in the last third of the book. While the first two thirds was like character development and I was bored. They easily defeated her abusers (then did gruesome torture) but the whole Julia was alive and fakes their mating bond crazy. Also I think the things with their parents feels wishy washy like…hmmmm idk. But now Ava and Jax can be a happy werewolf couple

title: For the Record
review: Stop. I loved that. I was a little peeved at the third act conflict but I appreciated the reconciliation. Omitting the truth is not lying it’s deception get your fucking terminology right. But also it felt like an overreaction, but then the apology was appreciated. Anyways I still loved this book. The slow burn was awesome; the dual pov, dual timelines worked REALLY well. I’m so tempted to give a ten but that third act conflict really upset me. I loved the characters’ banter and moments. I liked seeing Adam go with Rachel to visit her dad. Honestly this book was ducking incredible without the overreacting but then in her shoes I’d also probs overreact but I’d still give the guy a chance to explain…but it was so good and I was crying in a good way during the triathlon scene.

title: Bright Lights & Summer Nights
review: Wait I loved that. The BANTER omg and the tension??? THE SPICE?? SO good. And I liked that Emma got to explore/choose herself before finally choosing Preston. I won’t lie they moved fast. But the moments that they had at the beginning were fun and sweet. Obviously they’re all privileged and whatever but throwing a heel over a fence..what a meet cute. This book went so fast and I can’t believe the series is already over :( Until next time Singleton!

title: After All This Time
review: Bad bad bad. Okay maybe it’s just me who can’t take a compliment but I HATE when book boys are like excessively “you’re so gorgeous” “some random comparison to random object” like after you’re in a relationship sure but if you’re supposed to be enemies/rivals??? Where the slow burn? The book tries so hard to be deep and meaningful but just comes off wrong. He calls her so many different nicknames, the plot was choppy and doesn’t have smooth transitions, and there wasn’t enough exposition. I really thinks dual timeline would’ve helped the story. Like a timeline of them as children/rivals up to the point of not talking and also the timeline we saw. Plus it had so much mush. Like when it’s mushy it feels like the author was lazy and thought that comparisons to nature counted as plot…plot twist it DOESNT it’s boring and now you’ve overused how meaningful other compliments are. Also when I talk about anxiety I joke like “hahaha I’m anxious” not “my life is so hard bc of anxiety” like if the message is life is difficult with anxiety then SHOW me through the character’s experience don’t have them tell me their thoughts like…ya know?? AND WHY IS LITERALLY EVERY SIDE CHARACTER ~inspirational~ LIKE PLS BE NORMAL NO ONE TLAKS LOKE THAG IN REAL LIFE Like also you just wake up one day and realize you love this person after arguing for years and slightly bullying them??? Like no give me more evidence and build up OR have be that you always loved this person and didn’t know how to express it. God it’s like authors don’t know how to do their job 🙄

title: Emily Wilde's Encyclopaedia of Faeries
review: Ok this took a little to get into but once I was in…I was IN. Magic? Check. Strong FMC? Check. Slow burn? Magnificent. I won’t lie I felt like the first half of the book was exposition and that not a lot happened, but again once that plot hit…it hit. I love Emily and Wendell. I love their banter. I love how devoted he is even though she’s oblivious. I love his terms of endearment for her. I love how much she didn’t want to like him but couldn’t help it. I think that now I’m in the world, I really enjoy it.

title: Emily Wilde's Map of the Otherlands
review: I’m so fucking invested in Wendell and Emily. Like I love them so much. I highlighted so many random lines. I want to know how many books in this series bc I don’t want to imagine them not together. Honestly the whole book is Emily working to help Wendell find his door to his realm under the pretense of science/academic discovery and Wendell not really even caring that much about the door and wanting to be with Emily and fulfill her scholarly dreams. I love them i love them sm they’re basically my precious book children.

title: Play Along
review: I had fun with that one. The FOREPLAY *mwuah* I felt like Kennedy was kinda harsh at the beginning, but it all worked out in the end. Poor Isaiah was gone for her the entire time. I liked seeing them become better at vulnerability and learning how to better communicate with on another. I wish we got to see some of the other players’ stories. Honestly, I don’t think there’s anything I would change about how this book played out and I enjoyed the journey

title: Legendborn
review: WOW what a plot. I honestly really liked it! Still building my fantasy muscle…kinda missing romance but I’ve been busy. There was so much complexity to the characters, the plot and the world. I was definitely impatient for Bree to get to the truth but the build up was worth it. I don’t like the semi love triangle vibes with Bree, Nick and Sel but I hope that’s quashed quickly. I think the book’s theme of heritage and from where you came is thought provoking. About to make it about myself—but Bree’s heritage and family history was taken from her by a curse and she wants to know more/always had an underlying curiosity and reverence for it; I find that I feel rejected by my heritage and it makes me disinterested to know more. But anyways, this book really has it all and it was a fun read!

title: Bloodmarked
review: Yeah ok not sure what the fork happened but now I have to wait like for forever :(( I hope this moment is like Bri’s character growth with her impulsivity bc girly pop dives in head first consequences be damned. There were so many plot twists in this and the storyline is simply so complex that it boggles the brain. There was definitely the continuation of heritage and racism being relevant points. I know the main focus isn’t the romance but I don’t like the weird triangle/the maybe minor cheating?? Like pls just be friends. How can you say you love someone and then go and kiss their bounded bodyguard for life??? Anyways really not sure where it’s going to go from here but I’m excited!

title: Strictly the Worst
review: Okay fairly typical romance. Kinda forgot to resolve the brother issues and finally have the sit down where the older brothers recognize that Linc has matured and is ready to settle down. Also why was Linc’s mom so mean….that was just like cuts drama for the end?? But then Linc was lowkey really mean to her for being mean. You don’t tell your mom “You’re being a bitch” if you’re a grown 32 year old man you tell her “that was uncalled for” “that was inappropriate” “you were disrespectful” but ig grief and trauma which also should’ve been resolved with the family. I feel like the Salingers when I read them are fine but Myles particularly stirred the pot in this one unnecessarily and was just a duck. Also wanted resolution with Jared (the ex/the coparent) like some sort of show down. The book was good there were just a lot of loose ends that needed to be resolved with mostly family/side characters.

title: A Deal with the Bossy Devil
review: Ice cubes? Hot. New kink unlocked. This book was honestly great. The tension and the slow burn. The smut *chefs kiss* I think the third act happened the way it needed to happen. Was the third act great? No, but I don’t think that the author could’ve really done it another way with how they set it up. However the banter SO FREAKING GOOD. I really loved Adrien and Ria’s relationship and I think it happened the way it should’ve.

title: Failure to Match
review: The premise of this one was…interesting. Like a matchmaker and a billionaire client? Sure. Anyways I felt like the beginning was rough but the ending was good (kinda the opposite of the first one in terms of plot and smoothness of transition). I like that there wasn’t a third act break up. I felt like with this book I needed more showing versus telling. But overall I really enjoyed it. I like that Jamie wasn’t bought by Jackson’s monetary affections and their dry humor. dynamic was fun to read.

title: Until Now
