review: I’m not done with it yet but I have criticism. Holy shirt this book is disorganized and hard to follow. Who knows who’s talking to whom? Who knows why there’s a random Nick pov? Who knows the random new characters that don’t have any real relevancy in the book?? Then don’t even get me started on how annoying Nina is. She’s is clearly privileged and yes she has some family drama and her mom sucks, but she refuses to hear people out and her relationships with everyone is hot and cold. “My brother and I never got along” to “as long as my brother and father approve of my bf” like what??? Or “I only really knew her bc she was dating my brother” to “she’s one of my closest friends.” Or “my best friend Elizabeth” but not her maid of honor and kinda salty about it??? And the most infuriating relationship is Nina and Nick. There was so many opportunities to have moments between them that were missed. “We went for a hike and had some good conversation” should be a scene that’s written out and developed. Readers want to see the dialogue and the inside moments of these charactes’ relationship. And she’s all like “I love Nick” but then won’t hear him out?? Also the very premise of the book felt like it was missing something. Nina asks Nick to do the fake dating, he says no, then the next page is them packing their bags on a private jet to do the fake dating??? There’s just so much missing from this book like clearly marking when there’s a flashback to clearly marking who’s talking and overall the characters are inconsistent and annoying. Okay part two. I have no reason to root for Nina and Nick they hardly interact in the book. And then Nina’s random relationship that was maybe illegal bc she was a minor pops up out of nowhere?? And her father dies? There was just so many events in this book and not enough details about those events. I want the scene of Nina and Nick running together and them bantering. I don’t want “we came back from a run out of breath from laughing.” The storyline like 45% through stopped making any sense. Her mom was fucking her ex boyfriend (that ex boyfriend had also cheated on Nina with Nina’s ex best friend). Everyone was trying to convince Nina and Nick to be together but they were against it but then Nina was upset when he wouldn’t show up for her?? All of it was a mess and made me mad.

title: Wings of Stars
review: So, like I really wanted to like this one, however polygamy/polyamory is not for me. I think the world that was created was really interesting and I thought that Kieran was only slightly annoying/pick-me but you do really need like four or five guys all pining for her? And the wyvern turned into a man who also is pining after her? I think the prophecy and her unlocking her powers was a really good plot line, but there should only have been one love interest. Then she could have a bunch of other allies that are super cool in their own right but like not every side character’s sole purpose is to be a love interest. Also, there’s no reason for you to root for any of the couples except for maybe Ronan and Gabe. But Bastian was just kind of infatuated with Kieran and I guess there’s some sort of fated mates situation with Steele and the whole prophecy but they don’t like each other either. I just think I wasn’t the target audience for this book.

title: The Game Changer
review: Awwwww Lana Ferguson has yet to disappoint. And I think we share some of the same links but that’s beside the point. This is the standard romance novel I enjoy to read. Some fake dating, a sprinkle of hockey, brother’s best friend, no third act break up. The third act conflict was interesting but I think it worked. I loved that Delilah and Ian got their childhood friends to lovers moment. The banter and jokes were great just an overall solid rom com

title: Creatures That Breathe
review: I’m not really sure what the fork just happened but I had fun. Like the first one hundred pages could’ve been its own book. But then I think things started to make sense and the plot became more directed and clear. All the hot and cold between Cross and Leni was kinda confusing at the beginning and I really wish there had been a resolution to Leni losing her memories but overall it was fun wild crazy ride.

title: Conversations with Friends
review: Only good thing about this book was that it had a yellow cover. Ok I hated it. I liked it? Idk. So I was able to grasp some of the depth. Like not using quotations probably elevated some of the “which is dialogue and which is thought” thinking which is relevant to the title being Conversations with Friends. And I definitely think at the characters were complex but I didn’t like any of them. Nick was using Frances and a cheater. Frances was self destructive and seemingly failed to connect with other people and didn’t even feel like a main or real character until the end bc she was so passive in book. Like she was observant sure but often she wouldn’t actually say shirt. Melissa was a bitch who cheated on her husband while he was in a psychiatric hospital and then got upset when he cheated on her back when they weren’t really in a true marriage (but she was more mad at Frances who ig helped Nick be a better husband in the first place). Bobbi kept abandoning her best friend (not that Frances made it easy to stay) but none of these characters are good people. Ok ok and I get that no one can be perfectly moral or good but that doesn’t mean that you should act like morality doesn’t matter. They were all pretentious in their idiotic conversations about philosophy and other champagne problems but also SO privileged. Regardless of the circumstances why not TRY to be a good person it doesn’t seem like it should be hard. Make mistakes but learn and change your behavior. And the book doesn’t have any real resolution. Like Nick is probably going to back to cheating on Melissa with Frances. Frances will be upset he’s married. Melissa will be mad that she’s being replaced by a twenty one year old. Bobbi will be mad at Frances for something. Frances will be lowkey dying/dealing with her chronic pain but not doing anything to get help. And this book tries soooo hard to be an AP Lit book. Like I just feel it being on the booklist in 2045. Thought provoking and upsetting.

title: A Novel Love Story
review: Hmmm idk about this one. It was a pretty quick read. I don’t know if I like the Elsy ends up with her favorite author’s fiancé. Like yes the author is dead but it still feels like Elsy living in someone else’s story. I think that the fiancé living in the town made sense but still idk how I feel about the pair. Elsy did annoy me like girly pop why are you exploring basements and changing up the story—which is ofc the point but…I did enjoy the cameo from the previous book!! Overall it was pretty standard but wasn’t my favorite

title: Assistant to the Villain
review: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS BOOK. Omg this book literally had me silently screaming kicking my feet. I read the prologue and I knew it was going to be a good ride and HOMY shirt I WAS RIGHT. Evie—sunshine, badass, oopsies torture is cute, just chef’s kiss *mwuah* Trystan—hot name, antihero, ew feelings are gross but I can’t help it when I’m around her, dimple. There aren’t enough words to describe how happy this book made me feel to how frustrated I was at the cliffhanger. The climax *mwuah* the grumpy sunshine *mwuah* the banter *mwuah* Amazon best be quick with the sequel

title: Apprentice to the Villain
review: AHHHHH GIVE ME A BLASTED ENDING. Oh my gosh. That initial sequence *jaw dropped* too too good. This slow burn is KILLING ME pun unintended. This limbo their in….IM DYING. This book definitely felt very intermediary but gahhhh it kept up with the plot twists and mystery. And KINGSLEY!!! We love Kingsley!!! I worry about how long this book series will be but honestly I’m all here for it. I really love all the foreshadowing that happens and that there are references to things from earlier in the book it makes everything feel more intentional. Anyways, I’m very on edge for the finale

title: Sweet Keeper
review: This was your standard medium bad book. Like it wasn’t great there were cringy moments but it wasn’t deplorable. Stanley and Bree are sweet together albeit rushed and it’s kinda crazy that she’d give her life up for her two month bf. Lord knows if I’d done that for my two bf we’d have broken up by year three and my life would be fucked. Anyways ehhh kinda more excited for the next one

title: Sweet Desire (Sweet Talkers, #2)
review: Again standard medium bad book. The premise of the climax was flawed—how did the mother get into the bfs phone? You’re telling me it wasn’t passcode protected? No way. Again rushed but better than the first because they had previous friendship time. I don’t like how Ash handled the climax. Like she goes to Ryder’s father and asked him to invest in a modeling business??? After you just broke his sons heart??? Idk man. And also why was your first instinct to think that he’d actually done it? You didn’t even give the guy a chance to defend himself, and he obviously had an alibi. The beginning was fine but then it went downhill :(

title: Out On a Limb
review: I didn’t mind this one. I liked that Win and Bo were able to connect and understand each other in ways that other people couldn’t. The initial banter was very fun, but then we were very much caught up in Win’s head which was slightly frustrating when she wouldn’t accept help, but I imagine it’s hard for her to discern when people do it out of true kindness. I feel like I wanted to like it more, but overall it was okay

title: Love in the City
review: Got a love a medium bad romance book with so many clichés and insightful children. Honestly, I felt meh about it. I thought that Michael and Alex were sweet. Alex‘s mom was really a bitch though. It was kind of ridiculous, but in the kind of cringy way you’d expect from this kind of book. I mean come on she’s a writer who came to New York, and is now writing about her love for New York. I gotta give it to the author, though about how needlessly convoluted/friend group incestuous the climax was

title: You Know It's Love
review: My instant reaction to finishing this book? Oh thank god it’s over. I’m sorry but Cat the female protagonist? Fucking sucks. Like I don’t think there was any true acknowledgement for the way that she hurt Myles. Like yes you’re scared of commitment like every other fucking person on this planet but that doesn’t give you the right to judge a person, or fork them and tell them to leave in the morning, or consistently call them cocky or egotistical when they need money and being charming is the way to get tips, like I really didn’t see any redeemable characteristics to her. She tells him to go and then he goes after asking her if she will talk about how she’s feeling (she refuses) but then she freaks out about him rejecting her. She dismisses his feelings as if they don’t matter or as if he doesn’t actually feel them, and then she has the audacity to feel lied to when he decides to not tell her intimate parts of his life that were probably painful. Anyways, Myles deserved so much better and honestly Cat as a character deserved to be better.

title: Outrageously in Love
review: Significantly better than the last one, a little bit better than the first, but still not great. Okay I loved that they were little nerds finding their way and finding someone who got them. But couldn’t they have made Luke Michael’s best friend and their parents were super close? Or like the parents would be at the wedding? Idk. The siblings dating siblings feels so wrong. Also I hate when previous main characters are like villainized it’s just so uncomfy. Like Alex was such a bitch to Harriet, her own sister, after all that Harriet had done for her. Like girly pop Harriet planned your whole wedding, you’ve made fun of her throughout the book despite her help, and now you ask her “what’s wrong with you” do you know how shame coded that is? Honestly a lot of the friends seems like they were stirring up drama for no reason but whatever. Also why was Mel at the wedding? Seriously, no one wants to be at their ex’s wedding even if their child is going to be there and she wasn’t even part of the main relationship anyways….idk not great but not as bad

title: The Love You Deserve
review: You know what? I liked this one the best. I liked the pining and the slight bit of angst. I liked the spice and watching the relationship grow. I liked that there were dogs. I think the one thing I wished was for Josie to get a job at the shelter and the weird lion proposal was not it but you know what? There was healing there was forgiveness and I felt ok about all that happened with it.

title: Wild Eyes
review: Was the third act conflict predictable and dumb? Yes. Did I still enjoy the book? Yes. Was exactly what I was expecting? Yes. You know this was your very standard romance with it’s dumb third act conflict…the girl leaves to follow her career and bc she doesn’t want to hurt him, but then it’s somehow the guys fault for not fighting for her?? Like bro shouldn’t say give up your career for me…anyways it was still spicy and sweet and Skylar and West were likable characters. The children were too smart bc ofc, but I liked their little family and little story.

title: Spookily Yours
review: Yesss this was the silly cheesy bs I was missing a witch who adopts a cat that’s actually a demon? Yes please. Was it fated mates bs? Yes please. Loved that there was a touch of magic and overall unserious-ness. It was shorter than my typical read but honestly I really enjoyed it. I liked Damien and Willow as characters and this one helped me have an excuse to dnf another read. Very ready for fall and spooky season!!

title: Wickedly Yours
review: Yeah idk wasn’t feeling this one. It was longer than the first by a hundred pages (to its detriment) filled with mostly nonsensical shirt like how pretty the stars were or Luna’s annoying inner monologue. The text I sent Rachel earlier: “The character doesn’t even make sense. She’s living her dream in her hometown, but then chooses to leave, said dream to marry, a demon prince who is her soulmate. Why would she leave and if she left why would she be confused about her leaving? It feels pretty black and white to me. I don’t think we need to dwell on the gray. You leave because he’s your soulmate or you stay because you’re living your dream.” On the plus side the spice was fun but mostly I found both of the main character to be annoying

title: When the Moon Hatched
review: Bro I’m actually so upset that this ended on a cliffhanger. I was so excited too— like I saw the next one was coming out Oct 7…OF NEXT FUCKING YEAR YOU DUMBASS. Anyways I’m really proud of myself for how quickly I was able to pick up on things. I think I had to tune out some of the world building information/characters and then go back through to re read to make it make sense. But Raeve and Kaan? *chefs kiss* Dragons? Yes pls. Honestly the world building was great (idk if the romance could standalone bc it wasn’t fucking resolved). I liked the characters and that the complexity of the story is only starting to grow. But ughhhhh I have to wait until next year :(

title: One Dark Window
review: I’m really enjoying this fantasy kick. I’m glad that this is a duet and that both books are already out. I like the twisted world and magic. Kinda starting to understand that centuries old man inside young woman’s head is a fantasy trope? But the story is really engaging and I really can’t wait for the next one.

title: Two Twisted Crowns
review: Holy shirt. What a fucking ride. I kinda don’t know what happened but I know I enjoyed it. Honestly the whole two books feel like a fever dream.

title: Chase Our Forever
review: This felt very standard romance book. I have a slight bone to pick bc it’s always tough when it’s like the guy lost the love of his life and now is trying to be open for another? Idk. I thought the author did a nice job but like I don’t think I prefer that storyline. Anyways standard, ok, less spicy than anticipated from Kat Singleton

title: The Wall of Winnipeg and Me
review: Ehh I wanted to like this more than I did. First, the whole abuse thing with Diana should’ve been cut out the story was long and it felt like unnecessary trauma (Vanessa already had plenty childhood trauma). Second I didn’t really feel like Aiden fully redeemed himself..like idk he got better but he still kinda sucked to begin with? The marathon thing…idk like the whole body image stuff didn’t feel very “love yourself.” As I write this I think I had similar complaints about this author in a previous book where overall I didn’t mind it but the excess of trauma and not great messaging of body image and a main character not really redeeming themselves bugged me.

title: All Rhodes Lead Here
review: This one was much better than the one before it. I like that the Zapata didn’t put as much trauma or it didn’t feel as in the forefront. I thought the hiking was a little strange bc I’ve definitely done a 7mile hike in like 3 hrs so idk what kind of Colorado hike/falling down hike Aurora was on. And how do you not recognize an eagle? But I really liked Aurora and Rhodes. And I liked how the dad thing worked of this time I hadn’t seen it before but I liked it. I liked that it was a grumpyxsunshine friends to lovers. I liked that the third act thing didn’t last long. Although I’m confused why Am and Rhodes were actually mad at Aurora…but glad it was quickly resolved. This really felt like a solid standard small town romance.

title: Safety Measures
review: You know…typical shitty book. There wasn’t enough direction with the plot. The characters were already in love even though they were denying feelings and the obstacles they overcame didn’t feel realistic. I thought there were weird reactions at times and overall it wasn’t the vibe I love. The lip reading after Ares was deaf didn’t make sense to me and just the whole rehab and abuse thing with the mom was soo weird and not fully explained. Confused and ehh.

title: Peer Reviewed
review: I actually really enjoyed this one. I always love being able to see a relationship span a long period of time and how people weave in and out of one another’s lives. The miscommunication was painful, and the peer pressure was also painful. But I think it was good to see them deal with grief and be there to support one another. And it was also so satisfying to finally see them talk it out. I’m surprised that I didn’t find the characters annoying, but I really liked Jo and Isaac.

title: Academically Yours
review: Honesty kudos to the author for writing pretty unproblematic characters. However it was 100 pages too long. Like…I was sick and tired of hearing their inner monologues bc yes we get you’re in love and yes we get you think the other is attractive and yes we get you want to spend your future together. But like honestly I liked the spice and they weren’t too annoying I just felt like it could’ve been more concise.

title: Disrespectfully Yours
review: OK I found the FMC to be just so annoying. I was so excited because I thought that Angelina was going to be like relatable and hard on herself and perfectionist but no, she was just annoying. And Benjamin was so nice to her. It just was not cool for her to be a hypocrite. She was like upset that he didn’t trust her with something but girly pop didn’t trust him enough to have a relationship with him. And also, what is it with characters not giving the other character a chance to explain. Also, I thought that the formatting and structure of the book was kind of weird. I was expecting more time to be spent at the retreat/more time of them, hating each other. Overall, it was ehh

title: Fearlessly Yours
review: Oh my gosh so much inner monologue like will they please shut up thinking and just talk to one another. This book was really easy to step away from because it was so freaking boring. I re read two Ali Hazelwood books in between reading this one because I was so bored. The characters weren’t bad but there wasn’t enough actual interaction. Like they skimmed over what could’ve been really memorable scenes. I got detailed sex scenes but give me detailed scenes about them going hiking and she’s like out of breath and complaining and he’s like if you get to the top I’ll get you ice cream or something. The inner thoughts, mixed messages and baseless assumptions about the others feelings were also really annoying

title: Gracefully Yours
review: Thank god this book is over. Oh my god. You aren’t best friends if you can’t be honest about your feelings with them. And Charlotte was just so whiny. Please girl “Stand up” -Charlie. Same criticism as the last few too much fucking inner monologue

title: The Wedding Witch
review: Lol wacky plot but I liked it. Honestly the first ily moment needed a little more buildup and the whole climax needed a little more explanation but overall it was a fun crazy story. I liked Tamsyn and Bowen (met a Tamsin yesterday which was crazy) they were likable characters that weren’t annoying and didn’t inner monologue for pages on end.

title: Seven Days in June
review: I don’t have words. I feel weird reading this book in the way that I don’t want to fetishized or fall into the poverty porn mindset. It was a connecting moment when I could hear Dr. CJ in my mind about people in pain self medicating. But this book is just so enriched. It has perspective and depth and loss and grief and love and perseverance

title: A Witch's Guide to Fake Dating a Demon
review: I really liked this book. It was light and fun and overall a good time. I wish we had this really great moment of like Mariel unleashing a big wave of power/finally got to see her wield her prophetic strength. But I also really liked Oz. They were so grumpyxsunshine in the best ways. They were a little dumb but what can you do.

title: A Demon's Guide to Wooing a Witch
review: This one had a political undercurrent that hit a little too close to home. Don’t get me wrong love me some demon witch smut. The plot was fine, the timeline was but definitely accelerated which made the “light of my life” comment…interesting and I felt like the end was just eh. I didn’t like Calladia and Azeroth as much as the previous book but it was still a solid read. Anyways not mad, not bad, just decent.

title: A Werewolf's Guide To Seducing a Vampire
review: I rather enjoyed this one at the end. It took me a bit longer than the others. I think I felt weird about the whole she doesn’t understand the modern world and he helps her because it feels so power dynamic-y in the wrong way. But Ben was such a sweet MMC and I think was very compatible with Eleanore’s feistiness. Overall solid read

title: Love RX
review: She was incompetent as an adult and he made out with her when she was sick. So this book for me was gross and no.

title: Hate Mail
review: I actually loved this book. Like it was exactly the kind of book I love. Do I think Naomi overreacted a little at the climax? yes. But the rest of the book makes up for it. I loved the dual pov and dual timeline and seeing their “frenemy-ship” grow over a decade. I liked Luca and overall I really enjoyed reading. I mean it was over in 3hrs so I basically devoured it.

title: The Hot Henry Effect
review: Okay yes. This was fun. I wish there had been a dual timeline. But overall I didn’t mind the characters. Clara was oblivious and that was slightly annoying but it was fine. Liked the sticky note messaging. Solid read.

title: The Plot Twist
review: Ehh I don’t know how I felt about the reason they broke up in the first place. If you love someone, you trust them enough to tell them the truth. Also it just felt bogus that they would kiss and stuff before actually coming good terms.

title: The Love Interest
review: Ehh I liked this one better but it was kinda a downhill slope. The climax was really stupid. Again, if you love someone, you trust them enough to at least tell you their side. He was mad because she was writing about them? Really? I would’ve preferred a slow burn and maybe less introspection. Also cosplaying Mr. Darcy would not win me over.

title: Six of Crows
review: Thank goodness the whole series is out and I have them all because that would’ve been a nasty cliffhanger. I love it. I love all the subtle romances and adventure. I love the double and triple crossing. There are some phenomenal quotes. Once I was in, I was in. Can’t wait to see how the story ends.

title: Crooked Kingdom
review: I’m so upset. Was it really good? Yes. However I reserve the right to be angry at the ending. Because what the fuck? Was it necessary?? No. I loved all the tricks and heists and how someone was always one step ahead of another. Super fun to read but also very mad.

title: Red, White & Royal Blue
review: This was really good. Def was crying bc why can’t people let other people live their best gay lives?? Like seriously. The spicy scenes? Super hot. Reaffirmed that I like dick though. Honestly I really love books where the circumstance is the issue rather than the characters being emotionally stunted lumps. I really loved how Alex and Henry were just in love the entire time. I was definitely in agreement with the “omg just make out already” Anyways hit a little close with the election shit but a super fun read regardless

title: The Co-op
review: This was lowkey a fever dream. I feel like I only somewhat read it. I think I skimmed a bunch of it but I got the overall storyline. I didn’t really like LaRynn and Deacon…they were both annoying to me and they’re kinda related through marriage which feels wrong. Anyways it was just meh for me.

title: Leather & Lark
review: This was fecking psycho. I won’t lie this was what I was expecting and honestly it felt tamer than the previous one (not hard to do but still). I ended up liking Lark and Lachlan. Did not enjoy the teeth/pizza smoothie. I felt like this one had less suspense but I was okay with that. Overall it was a solid read.

title: Lessons in Chemistry
review: IM STILL SO SAD. I was sobbing during the Harriet Sloane chapter. Powerful and provocative, but thoroughly depressing. This was a book that needs to be read but it’s really fucking hard to read. I loved Elizabeth’s character and just how she is an absolute force of a person. Still crying inside

title: Throne of Glass
review: That was pretty good. Not loving this growing love triangle :( Honestly a fan that most of the women are the good guys while it’s mostly men that are the bad guys. I really want to see Celaena unleash a shit ton of magical power on some of these mfs. I feel like it’s being foreshadowed that her magic will come back or be undead. Anyways, on to the next!

title: Crown of Midnight
review: Okay okay I’m still so on edge because I can feel a betrayal on some horizon somewhere. I don’t think Chaol’s actions this time was a true betrayal, but dude really should communicate better. Are Dorian and Calaena going to be just friends? Dorian is magical wooooooo. I forgot to finish this review and already started the next one, but it was a pretty good read!

title: The Assassin's Blade
review: That was so hard to read already knowing what vaguely happens. Why couldn’t she and Sam just had a happy life somewhere else?? Why did Arobynn have to be such a little bitch?? I really liked that it felt like a collection of interconnected novellas, but this was a heartbreaking story. I don’t think I can read it again.

title: Heir of Fire
review: Bro tell me why so much fucking happened in the last fifty pages while I was slogging through the middle. Loving the new characters and new plot lines. Also really ducking sad and just anticipatory anxiety for the next one. Why can’t there be happy endings?? Anyways really enjoying the series despite feeling overwhelmed by how much of it there is left.

title: Queen of Shadows
review: Ok ok this one was really good. There was so much to keep track of but I really liked the fast pace, the plot twists, and the battles of wit and deception. I liked how there was a satisfying ending even though there’s a lot more story to come. I was very scared many times throughout, but I was very pleased. I kinda can’t believe that the King of Adarlan was just a figure head for Duke Perrington.

title: Empire of Storms
review: Holy shirt this was so devastating. Hasn’t she been through enough??? I LOVE that all the storylines are converging. I can’t believe how many freaking enemies there are, but I also love seeing all the new allies rally behind Terrasen. I love that Aelin made good on her promise to call in debts and we see the pay off of all that she’s suffered thus far. Super fun to be re introduced to characters from before. Okay as a side it why didn’t Elide even try to run?? I feel like she was lowkey kinda useless during the beach scene— not that it was her fault— just that she was useless. And Lorcan I hope gets the fate he deserves. And why were Gavriel and Lorcan so hurt by the blood oath being broken?? And why is Aedion being so pissy? Much confusion.

title: The Marriage Auction: Book One
review: This series was just good trashy fun. All the characters were dumb as rocks the premise was laughably stupid and overall it was a great read. There were very predictable outcomes, raunchy scenes, and marrying men after less than a month. Good times. I liked that it was four stories throughout four books, kept me on my toes.

title: The Marriage Auction: Book Two
review: This series was just good trashy fun. All the characters were dumb as rocks the premise was laughably stupid and overall it was a great read. There were very predictable outcomes, raunchy scenes, and marrying men after less than a month. Good times. I liked that it was four stories throughout four books, kept me on my toes.

title: The Marriage Auction: Book Three
review: This series was just good trashy fun. All the characters were dumb as rocks the premise was laughably stupid and overall it was a great read. There were very predictable outcomes, raunchy scenes, and marrying men after less than a month. Good times. I liked that it was four stories throughout four books, kept me on my toes.

title: The Marriage Auction: Book Four
review: This series was just good trashy fun. All the characters were dumb as rocks the premise was laughably stupid and overall it was a great read. There were very predictable outcomes, raunchy scenes, and marrying men after less than a month. Good times. I liked that it was four stories throughout four books, kept me on my toes.

title: You, Again
review: This was a fun read. I feel ehhh about it in the sense that both of the characters are problematic and didn’t actually seem to be helping each others vices?? Like their interactions were fun to witness, but were they really good for each other?? I felt like Ari was just sooo terrified the entire time and super unwilling to even try to be trusting and Josh was not acknowledging that and just felt ehhh during the middle/end. I don’t know they could’ve been more adult about it I think but overall still a fun read especially in the beginning.

title: Fake It 'til You Make It
review: A very medium bad read. Like it was fine but the premise was dumb and the characters were dumb but not in a fun this is ridiculous dumb in a this book is trying too hard to be a good book. Nothing spectacular

title: A Rivalry of Hearts
review: Ok Will deserved the money more than Edwina based on reasons for needing it alone. Hers were more self-serving and less noble than supporting a family member and she gets all angry at him for “lying to his fans” and to her which she doesn’t have grounds to really stand on. She kinda annoyed me because of these things but overall I had fun

title: My Feral Romance
review: I ended up liking the ending it just was so predictable? Anticlimactic? The beginning was meh the middle was ughhh and the end was ehh. I don’t know how they can really be considered friends but whatever. Also the solution to their issue seemed so dumb. Anyways overall unimpressed, but fine

title: Tower of Dawn
review: Yrene was the best thing about this book. That one guy in Instagram talking about deep throating Sarah J Maas’ massive dong was right. This needed to be edited down bc why was the last hundred pages the most interesting. Please. There were really good moments but there were so many moments I could easily put it down and walk away. Also someone needs to explain Chaol to me because wtf. I really should’ve done the tandem read. I also really would’ve preferred to have more intros on Yrene and Sartaq like we did for Manon and Aedion. Uhhhhh yeah I’m told the last one goes quick so excited for that. Also side note that I totally guessed the real villain being Maeve but there also seems to be more higher ups??? Like Gods playing with their lives

title: Kingdom of Ash
review: Holy fucking shit. Wow um okay. Honestly I’m surprised that more people didn’t die. Like I was sobbing during the chapter about the Thirteen, but I honestly was expecting more deaths. Maeve was so….I still don’t fully get her. Like she was scared of the brothers?? What was her goal? To stay and rule? Why not find a nice little human home to camp out? Why be unnecessarily cruel? Is it the hurt people hurt people thing? Okay can we normalize having like heroines that are not teenagers?? Why is Aelin not even twenty?? Like she’s been tortured and maimed on several occasions and is still fine?? This was indeed a good end to the series. I loved seeing all the plot lines merge. Where did the wolf tribe even come from? Honestly kinda started to dislike Yrene for being in love with Chaol…like Chaol? Really? He was basically useless this whole series. Which is honestly impressive to be useless for so long. Where did the little God strolling come into play? Like they were mad that Brannon broke his promise or that Elena changed the course of the promise?? Why did they feel the need to re-kill Elena?? Like the gods motives and role came in and just didn’t make total sense or it felt out of left field. Honestly a lot of the vague war facts could’ve been cut down and I was skimming those pages anyway. Okay yeah I think those are all my thoughts. Maybe should’ve killed Chaol and somehow saved Yrene and the baby…might’ve liked him more if he self sacrificed. Ok wait I also think Gavriel’s death felt out of place like what the heck happened he just walked out to hold off the Valg?? When he could’ve stayed inside the gates?? Was it a noble act or a stupid one? Okay I’m really done now.

title: The Marriage Auction 2: Book 1
review: It amazes me how much bullshit is out there in the world to just consume. This, like the first marriage auction, was good old fashioned wattpad bullshit that was actually so dumb and the characters were dumb and the plots were dumb and yet I couldn’t stop. I liked the first better because who in their right mind has a funeral and a wedding in the same day…and why did all the couples have to have children in the end…??? And overall the characters did things that made them happy but made me thoroughly question their judgment beyond just the auction. Anyways kinda glad it’s over bc I was losing brain cells.

title: The Marriage Auction 2: Book 2
review: It amazes me how much bullshit is out there in the world to just consume.
