This, like the first marriage auction, was good old fashioned wattpad bullshit that was actually so dumb and the characters were dumb and the plots were dumb and yet I couldn’t stop. I liked the first better because who in their right mind has a funeral and a wedding in the same day…and why did all the couples have to have children in the end…??? And overall the characters did things that made them happy but made me thoroughly question their judgment beyond just the auction. Anyways kinda glad it’s over bc I was losing brain cells.

title: Beginner's Luck
review: This was so cute!! I loved it. I liked the STEM vibes I liked the characters I liked just almost all of it. There were a couple times that people jumped to conclusions but I really like the story overall. They were very reasonable people. Big fan

title: Luck of the Draw
review: This one was really good. It might have been because I was sleep deprived but I was so engrossed in the story. I really like that the intimate moments feel like they actually had an impact..like they just felt more potent than some of the flimsy horniness that most characters have. I liked that Zoe and Aidan’s journey was about grief and forgiveness. Especially, forgiveness for yourself. While the premise was wack, I really liked reading their relationship develop from the cold resentment to the appreciation and affection. I don’t know I really dug this book. It had a little grumpy sunshine, a little enemies to lovers. I felt like they were honest and while somehow they could magically guess what the other needed the seriousness didn’t come off in the wrong way. Anyways solid read

title: Best of Luck
review: This one was meh in comparison to the others. I didn’t feel particularly engrossed in the story. I did enjoy the characters and how they change each other for the better and push each other to self improve. I just worry that the ending gave off vibes that like finding your person will solve everything which like yeah it’s a romance book but also I don’t know. Overall, the story was fine just not my favorite.

title: Deep End
review: I’m sorry but Ali Hazelwood is forever and always probably going to be my favorite. I’m getting to the weird point in my life where I’m the same age as these characters and it feels like my accomplishments are so inconsequential. Regardless, this was a fun read and even tho it’s not necessarily my fav Ali Hazelwood book it was still very good. The kinky shit? Fun. The messy characters…not as fun. I will forever be silently squeaking at Olive and Adams cameos. I feel like Scarlet and Lukas were super obvious the whole time and no one cared until they did. Plus the codependent relationship with Penelope was just…ehh? I wasn’t super following all of the diving competitions but I did enjoy the honesty and intimacy that Scarlet and Lukas shared. They seemed mostly healthy. Anyways Ali Hazelwood is my romance novel goddess and I will read anything she writes.

title: Finding Mr. Write
review: This was so mid. Idk it started off fine and then it was a downwards slope…in the bad context. The third act break up was so dumb. I know that Daphne was upset and scared and Chris should’ve handled it differently, but Chris was definitely right in not wanting to act like a cowriter. He clearly saw the best in her and wanted her to be seen that way. Did he do the right thing by leaving? No. But this line “He wanted to take an ethical stance, even if it cost Daphne her career” is crazy. You would ask someone you care about to give up what they feel is right for your own personal gain? That’s called being selfish. I do think they should’ve discussed what to do, so in that Chris was definitely in the wrong and coming back was definitely in the wrong, but I guess the initial starting point of considering Milner’s plan felt like it was Daphne in the wrong. Anyways….ehh

title: Love Interest
review: I only just liked it. It was a fun read but not memorable or anything extraordinary. They all had parental issues though and it showed.

title: Forget Me Not
review: The favorite author of my favorite author is also my favorite author idk. This book was so good. The tension. The second chance. The PINING. God I love a man that is already in love with a woman for years and she’s just oblivious. Then he does not so subtle protective things? My favorite. Elliot and Ama were soo much fun to read. The spice was so freaking good. The tension again was so palpable but I was kicking and squealing

title: Not Another Love Song
review: Nooooo don’t be over pls. *sigh* I totally agree with Ali Hazelwood. Julie Soto is a magnificent writer and I would read anything she writes. The spice the tension the pining. All the good things. There were so many ops in this book it was crazy. Alex begging for any scrap of Gwen she was willing to give him was *chefs kiss* the fighting the atttaction part. All of it so so good.

title: Wild Side
review: I enjoyed this one. I don’t think I’ll ever date a wrestler but still. Enemies to lovers, the spice, the lack of miscommunication, honestly it was a pretty good read. Tabby and Rhys didn’t automatically assume the worse about one another which is refreshing, they had the important conversations, and idk they seemed to compromise and be supportive. Not really looking forward to the next book in this series bc ex’s father trope kinda disgusts me. Why do these authors have such awful daddy issues?

title: Strictly Pretend
review: Ahhh I can’t believe the Salinger saga is over! I’m pretty sure I started it when only one or two books were out and now there are six of them. I ended up enjoying this one. I felt like Brooks was a little dumb not to tell Emma the news about the building when he found out, but the real villains were the ex and Brook’s dad. Why are men suck jerks? I felt like for the most part Emma and Brooks didn’t assume the worse, mostly communicated, and were attentive to one another. Anyways solid read and good ending to a series.

title: The Desire Variable
review: I am absolutely outraged that this ended on a cliffhanger. What the actual fork. I feel like this was really well written. Surprisingly enough I got to a point where I was like this is a lot of spice…does there need to be this much???? Could we see some intimate, fully clothed scenes? Okay but seriously 500 pages about one couple and you’re going to write two more books about them??? I’m so upset because this book was actually pretty good, and I was getting ready for the wrap-up/HEA only to be BLINDSIDED BY A DUCKING CLIFFHANGER. Okay but seriously the enemies to lovers was so good…there were some vaguely problematic moments but for the most part I lowkey wish I had her job. I wouldn’t fork my boss but working with ASL and coding and such would be so freaking cool.

title: Accidentally Ours
review: This was good but pls pls pls figure out your daddy issues and start dating people your own age. The accidental pregnancy was just so ehhh. Overall it was a fine read but like the ending was just so…not it. Why was her brother such a dick about things in the end? Why did there have to be a pregnancy? Why couldn’t there have been a different ending? Why were there twins? Honestly this would be my nightmare.

title: Surprisingly Us
review: This was not it for me. Dick piercings seem gross, both of the main characters were dumb as hell, and overall I didn’t really care about how it all ended. Why on earth would you propose to your fake gf without consulting her first? Even if I was dating someone, we would need to have had the conversation that we would get married before they popped the question. There was so much opportunity here with them being childhood friends and they completely balked out.

title: Scythe & Sparrow
review: Ehhh. This wasn’t it for me. Aside from the violating of a new food. I didn’t like Rose, and I didn’t understand Fionn. They were both…kinda dumb. I didn’t like that Rose was so bad at being a serial killer. Like so bad, zero plan. The biggest thing about this book is that characters don’t DO anything. They go to a crochet club, they kill a guy, do they do anything else?? Not really. She’s usually on the road, then he was in Croatia, like did they even really know each other?? Why not show them hanging out at home making meals or something like that?? Anyways…ehh

title: The Swedish Prince
review: Huh. I liked this one. I wasn’t fully ready for the trauma upfront but overall this was a fun silly story. There were lowkey two or three break up moments but luckily they were all quickly resolved. Overall pleased.

title: The Wild Heir
review: I also liked this one. Upbeat, goofy, spicy, honesty, all the good things. Marriage of convenience and enemies to lovers can you ask for more? Anyways I liked Magnus and Ella and the storyline, some of the side characters were weird but whatever. Solid read

title: The Royal Rogue
review: Huh well…that was something. I feel like I liked the beginning but the climax/third act break up really upset me. I mean it was dumb to begin with, but I don’t know just so weird. Like princess gets pregnant with a prince who is currently fake dating a tennis player who is secretly a lesbian? Yeah sure okay.

title: A Nordic King
review: This was interesting. Most of the time I’m good at ignoring some of the age gap/power dynamic inconsistencies, but this one almost exacerbated or emphasized it. I don’t know…I wanted to think that they were cuter together than maybe they were?? Why was her past invoking her being an accomplice to a crime? I think if you took out some of the more problematic aspects I’d like it more, and it wasn’t awful it just was weird.

title: Under Loch and Key
review: You know what that was cute if not slightly…weird but mostly cute. I love a good fated mates story with a little enemies to lovers and a little history adventure. What did Key do for a living? How were they paying the bills? I know it’s not the point but like are they just farmers? Anyways Lach and Key were fun and honestly appreciated how the third act went down. Could’ve been so much worse. Key was a little slow but like it’s fine. They both were a bit dense. Overall solid read with light magic and monster cock.

title: Phantom
review: The drama at the end was crazy. The brother was the one to set the fire leave like a coward and cause his brother’s death? Typical mafia stalker crazy dark romance book, ya know? Fun phantom vibes…but also if a man said “sing for me” whilst doing sex or fellatio I’d be drier than the Sahara and ask him to leave.

title: Haunted Love
review: This was like the worst possible version of brother’s best friend. Let’s all say it together, “the brother doesn’t get an input on his sister’s life because it’s not fucking 1850.” Okay but aside from the brother being unreasonable both of the main characters were toxic. They would assume things about the other and get angry based on those assumptions. They didn’t actually communicate on large issues. They both repeatedly hurt each other, he would keep asking for space (which to me doesn’t sound unreasonable) and she would try to make him jealous (she was also lowkey incompetent but like ig she killed a man so not entirely). Not that I expected any of that healthy relationship stuff but a girl can hope. Still can believe the brother punched his own sister and didn’t seem sorry until she was almost raped and then still didn’t approve of the relationship…it’s your bestie and sister be happy for them…you get to keep both of them in your life

title: Rouge
review: I wanted to like this one more than I did. It’s just that they hardly did anything together besides fuck. And like the mafia stuff was just okay. But she was justifying not being with him bc of her dad being in jail but her dad couldn’t give a rat’s ass about her and I don’t like the blind loyalty. Like her dad had her betrothed to an abuser wtf?? And she KEPT being like “we can’t be together yet bc I need to find more evidence to save my father” but girly pop was going crazy talking to elephants on the walls while he did all the scheming. I don’t know…I don’t like it when the FMC is useless and she was pretty useless in this.

title: Playing Flirty
review: Hehe I love when they’re meant to be. Okay but one thing really bothered me. Why the fork were we even considering the ex during the third act break up? Why did her mom and bff accept a man who subtly belittled her? Were they blind? Dumb? They’d already broken up why even let this happen. Now I know it’s probably ohh she needed to figure it out on her own but it felt like by them allowing it as a possibility she chose to consider it when he was lowkey a terrible person. Okay but otherwise this book was great. Loved all the nerdiness and the board games. Loved that they had already met. Loved that he’d been pining for her the entire time. Love that it was rivals to lovers. Loved the stolen moments and not so subtle flirting. Honestly it was great!

title: Perfectly Wicked
review: This was pretty fun!! I just feel like Grimm’s whole motivation/exploitation from the beginning felt so so wrong but I think he makes up for it in the end. The sister posing the idea for a reality show with the ex was wild. Also the whole time the wicked Ms were like “omg we need to be careful” but then like did not have any caution. But anyways overall they were cute together and they evened each other out which I loved. Solid read!

title: Not the Witch You Wed
review: She loves him but won’t talk to him to hear what he has to say? Bullshit. Why did she have to become Prima? She didn’t even really want it. Overall I enjoyed. But there were some consistency errors. Like stick to a feeling about the guy. It was very much a playbook romance. Solid read, nothing incredible.

title: The Break-Up Pact
review: I felt pretty ehhh about this one. Honestly it was just fine. I don’t know if I’m being overly critical or if I just couldn’t get into it because I was over analyzing things. The characters were fine they had trauma they dealt with it. They communicated mostly. They were mostly not passive aggressive. Just not anything spectacular in my opinion. I just didn’t feel invested in them I guess.

title: Roommaid
review: Let’s all say it together, incompetence is NOT cute. Ok I get the whole not knowing stuff because you’re rich and privileged but then if you say you’re going to look it up online look it up online!!! Cmon get your act together or ask for help or literally do anything but what Madison does. And I don’t buy that Tyler loves her…because why? What did she do? When did they even spend time together? Please riddle me this. Plus it felt disgusting for her to be lusting after him after he explicitly set the platonic boundary. AND after his own kind of stalker situation. Maybe I’d feel different had this been a dual pov but the flagrant disregard for a clearly set boundary was gross to me.

title: The Hook Up
review: Ok you know what I liked this one but the ending felt vaguely co dependent. I’m no genius but there needs to be some balance between being and individual and being pair of a couple. I feel like you need to live for yourself and not someone else…and like be able to live without someone else. I don’t know. It could be worse and overall it was a solid read just not my fav.

title: The Friend Zone
review: I liked this one too. It just took me a while to get through. I felt like the storyline was fine and the characters were fine, but it wasn’t a book that I gobbled up in three hours. I liked that the characters were mostly reasonable and talked through stuff. I know they had their demons and such but I’m glad they worked through it.

title: Wolf Gone Wild
review: I don’t know I really liked this one. Like the characters were just adorable. And the admiration they held for one another was apparent but not too over the top. NO THIRD ACT BREAKUP WOOOOO. I really like paranormal romances when MMC is a werewolf namely bc breeding kink but also the possessiveness and the like having a hard time being in control/restraint. Anyways, I wonder who is next in the series….

title: Fundamentals in Flirting
review: This was cute. I really wished that Hannah didn’t assume the worst of him every time. Although I guess Teddy wasn’t fully communicative either. But it didn’t feel fair. Also Mandy being so juvenile was just so odd. Honestly I really liked Ted, and I wish that we’d seen his feelings validated more. I also wish we’d seen Hannah like actually like him…?? Like I guess the scavenger hunt. I was a little confused because didn’t they have like full time jobs?? Did everything happen in the weekend and I couldn’t tell?? Anyways this was a solid read!

title: The Game Plan
review: This was alright. I was caught off guard by the smashing of his house at the end. Honestly it didn’t feel worth it. Dex was infatuated for no clear reason, and Fiona didn’t seem that interested in him either other than looks…? I thought it could be better. Also how did that one bimbo get his phone? And then on top of that how was she able to unlock his phone? Also I feel like he had a traumatic experience with sex and that was never addressed when they first did the deed. I feel like there would be like flashbacks or trauma. I think there would’ve been a good moment to have real connection between them. Overall it was fine.

title: Don't Hex and Drive
review: I’m so horny and that was so good. It had action, comedy, romance, smut, vampires, witches…can I really ask for much more?? Honestly the biggest thing was Isadora getting over her initial impression of Devraj but like ultimately…no third act break up??? I’m a happy reader. I’m really curious if there will be a book with a grim as the

title: The Hot Shot
review: This was cute. I felt annoyed with the characters for a lot of the book because they wouldn’t just talk to one another. Then there were moments that they would talk and it was beautiful and all I could think was why were you not doing that before??? Also Chess “lost everything” except she lives with an NFL player that dotes and is clearly in love with her. I really didn’t understand the hesitations that they had before getting together…or why the third act breakup was necessary…or why there had to be two hospital emergencies in the like last chapter???

title: Witches Get Stitches
review: Again cute. I was confused because I thought they were kinda enemies in previous books??? Overall I enjoyed. I liked Violet and Nico, but like dealing with werewolf prejudice felt…preachy?? Like it was something bigger than a romance book? Idk the main antagonists were not even really antagonists and I would say they should’ve been grown ups and talked through their stuff but ig the point is that there werewolf side was untamed or beastly? Nico and Violet were actually cute and I liked them…just some of what happens to them is ehh

title: Always Practice Safe Hex
review: I thought this was good. I wanted more of their enemies to lovers. I feel like we see things in earlier books that don’t carry through and I would’ve liked to see some of the tension and angst from the beginning. It just feels like we’ve started halfway through them falling in love. Anyways, Livvy and Gareth were cute. Kinda weird that he’s sixty five but whatever. Also was caught off guard that there was fully an execution…but ok.

title: Resting Witch Face
review: That was emotionally a lot for me. The torturing was crazy and losing her memories of her family was devastating. Quietly crying on the plane. Again, I wish we saw more of their dynamic if the initial draw to the break up to the animosity to the build up to being together again. We only really got that last bit and even then it was only like half of it. The third act climax went crazyyyy again torture and executions were not what I was expecting (not in a bad way ig). Anyways the smut was good and overall they were pretty cute.

title: The Governess Game
review: Teehee so I finished another one. Honestly really love this series. Alex and Chase were kinda dumb but it’s okay. I love when the nanny trope is done right and I feel this one did well. I don’t know if a real Chase could exist, one that was so insecure and yet so kind….Anyways, I liked that Alex was a badass astronomer and that she took care of the children as they needed to be cared for. Honestly their romance lowkey confused me but whatever gets you going I guess.

title: The Duchess Deal
review: I can’t believe I read that one so quickly. Honestly I loved it. Regency era, grumpy sunshine, marriage of convenience, overall I thought it was a blast. Emma and Ash were so cute together. I loved all the bantering and the teasing. I really can’t believe how quickly I finished it. Something I really appreciated was how capable Emma was. Like yesss we love a strong FMC with a MMC that supports her.

title: Grim and Bear It
review: I enjoyed this one. Definitely grumpy sunshine, and I was kinda expecting the accidental pregnancy. I honesty really enjoyed that they were so unproblematic. I liked that they faced things together as opposed to against one another. The whole plot though was crazy. Helping Henry’s father whose lover had been killed and the father had been framed. The real murderer was the business associate. The business associate kills Clara, but then she’s revived in like five pages. Anyways fun times, can’t believe I’ve finished the series!

title: The Wallflower Wager
review: Okay I was a little worried that Penny would be too quirky for me but I loved her. This book was great, definitely scandalous for the time period but great. I think that Penny and Gabe were so cute together and it was definitely grumpy sunshine vibes. I wish there had been more about Penny than just “she cares” because I can guarantee that there’s more to her. Anyways, still cute, so many animals to take care of, wish we knew what happened to Herbert.

title: The Modern Girl's Guide to Magic
review: I would’ve enjoyed this more if I haven’t been feeling ill on the ferry. Overall it was okay. There wasn’t a lot of interaction between Callan and Aria. Like I feel like they didn’t do much together. But it was still fun and still cute. I wish there had been an apology from Serena. The world and competition were fun!

title: How to Fake-Date a Vampire
review: This was cute but also exceedingly mediocre. Like I could easily set it aside and be bored and have no inclination to pick it back up. I kinda would’ve liked more enemies. They became friends so quickly. Also like I know the self discovery and her magic whatnot was supposed to be big, but I wasn’t all that impressed…maybe I’m just a cynic. It was a cute book, just nothing spectacular.

title: From the Start
review: The ability of these characters to meet each other where they are at is incredible. Like so healthy of them. And it’s a mutual respect that they exchange, and when grief hits there’s empathy in how the grief is handled. Like overall this characters were really fucking compatible and just good people. Also can’t believe I finished this in like two and half hours.

title: Romancing the Duke
review: Wow I’ve been busy. This was really cute! Pretty predictable, but overall great. Historical romance, enemies to lovers (kinda), the ending was a little drawn out, and the whole fandom for her books being there was definitely odd too, but it was a silly, fun, spicy book so I can’t complain.

title: Say Yes to the Marquess
review: Tessa Dare books are simply fabulous. “I’m not with child. I’m with dog.” Cackling. Period drama, forbidden romance, spice, melodramatic sisters, fighting (off page), independent FMC, overall wonderful. Honestly go off Clio, break off that engagement, get that brewery, and eat your cake.

title: When a Scot Ties the Knot
review: Scot ties a knot, and it’s everything it ought…to be. Anyways love love love. So excited there’s a whole plethora of books to read by Dare!! This was so good. The letters the teasing, enemies? to lovers, the tension, the everything I swear I almost finished it in a day but then work got in the way. I worried for a sec at the end but Dare came through. Truly though Maddie and Logan (good name) were adorable and while I can’t imagine a Scottish accent the “n’t” being “na” was very silly fun.

title: A Night to Surrender
review: I honestly don’t remember when I finished this one. But it took forever and lowkey put me in a slump…. The characters were fine…I just didn’t care and they were like weird. It felt like they were both trying to change each other and both said something to the effect of “oh they need me” which is just ehh. Like no need to change them into who you want them to be…

title: Rewind It Back
review: I finished a book!! I DNFed several but I finally finished one!! Reading Rio and Hallie’s story made me so happy. Childhood friends to lovers to enemies to lovers. I guessed the reason they became enemies early on (gotta love a predictable plot) Rio had been a flirt the rest of the series and it was so exiting to see him finally be with his person. I loved the playlists and the history and all the special moments that were throw backs or references. Can’t believe this series (is over??) already at five books! Love love love and can’t wait to see what else Liz Tomforde writes!

title: Friends, Lovers, and the Big Terrible Thing
review: This book devastated me. It was so striking how badly he wasn’t able to accept himself or feel good about himself and constantly sought out external validation. There was something really depressing because I had an awful thought three fourths of the way through “wait he used again?” But I was rooting for him and all of the profoundness is furthered by the fact of his passing. Devastating.

title: An Unexpected Paradise
review: Wellll this was not it. I listened to it 3x and just stopped caring about a third of the way in. The plot was kinda lost early on and they were mostly in love the entire book (but it wasn’t enough tension to make it worth) Also they had conversations that would never happen in real life and listening to it was a lot harder to get over than it would be reading (kinda like when there are movie adaptations)

title: Accomplice to the Villain
review: HOLY FUCKING shirt IT HAPPENED. SPOILERS AHEAD AHHHHHH THEY SAID ILY, AND WHAT THE HECK MARV, and well all of the other plot twists didn’t REALLY surprise me but I was happy about them except Arthur!! (Kingsley turning, Trystan being prince, Evie being the Villain). I still have so many questions. What are Lyssa’s powers? What happens with the guivres? Did Winnifred do it?? How is Kingsley back? I feel like the prophecy or story of Rennedawn feels really straight forward but I bet there are a few more tricks to come. I love this series. I love Hannah and I loved meeting her. This book launch was so fucking cool to witness and be a part of. Next book “Actually the Villain”?????

title: Overruled
review: This was so cute. I loved it. From beginning to end it was engaging and there was tension and just all of it was great. I liked how everything was resolved for Ezra and Dani like it all made sense and didn’t upset me. I want more. I want to know more about how they met and how they started their initial dalliance. Honestly just wonderful black cat golden retriever, rivals/enemies to fwb to lovers, good side characters. I really liked also that they are for the most part reasonable, likeable people.

title: The Heir: An Enemies-to-Lovers Marriage of Convenience Romance
review: Look at that I finished another book! Honestly had fun. Enemies/rivals to lovers that actually held on to the tension until the end. Was a little disappointed that Emory assumed the worst of Aiden at the climax, like girly pop just like talk to him?? But the spice, the hating that they like each other, the siblings/side characters, overall good vibes.

title: Potions and Prejudice
review: This book was dumb. It was a retelling of Pride and Prejudice in an overt way that wasn’t appealing to me….I didn’t really find anything all that redeeming which saddens me to say—granted this is a much more retrospective review. However, I was definitely actively skimming to get through it. It had a good idea but not great follow through

title: Rose in Chains
review: Ok ok the human trafficking was very fanfic coded and it’s crazy to me that it got published. HOWEVER, I ended up being super engaged at the end and enjoyed the book overall. I did lookup the actual fanfic and it was fun to read the whole thing and see some of the changes. I’m curious which parts the published trilogy will actually include

title: Love Arranged
review: This relationship was so toxic. There wasn’t enough communication of boundaries and expectations and then feelings were hurt. I think it’s dumb that your family should get so much a say in who you choose to date and while I get asking for blessings before proposing is tradition….it’s not the end of the world. The whole middle of the book is Lily trying to get Lorenzo to admit his feelings for her (which he has) but it’s not on his terms which felt wrong to me. Then it was hot and cold until the end when they finally talked to one another and at that point I was ready to be done anyways..feeling like a cynic with all these reviews

title: Truly Madly Deeply
review: This was so bad. The characters didn’t make sense, were not likeable, and were inconsistent. I was STRUGGLING to finish. The spice wasn’t even good. The trauma was so unrealistic and insane. The needless violent was annoying and honestly? I can’t think of something redeemable….my bad

title: Wildest Dreams
review: Again this was so bad. Characters were annoying, inconsistent, and just confusing. I skimmed most of it so that might be why I’m confused but this could’ve been edited down. I also just don’t get the unnecessary trauma like it comes out of left field. Why is the kid kidnapped? With no real motive? The whole book had me complaining “Just why??”

title: A Thousand Pieces of You
review: Bro this was so good I went through everything. I cried I screamed I probably laughed. I liked that this was sci fi ish. The romance was great the plot was great. I was right five pages in (let’s goooo!) i’m interested to see where book two goes.

title: Ten Thousand Skies Above You
review: What the actual fuck. Ummm so the plot is working overtime. Paul goes after Conley to find a cure for Theo. So Conley splinters Paul, Marguerite goes after pieces of Paul’s soul…this causes her to question her love with Paul. There’s a Warverse, Medievalverse, One where Paul hurts her hand so she can’t art anymore, one where Paul is part of an organized crime family with his dad. But there’s this whole potential love triangle with Theo who doesn’t really stand a chance but for more suspense. But the whole backstory is that the original Triad includes Conley and her parents trying to bring back Josie who tried to leave her body at the moment she died and splintered. So they’re trying to destroy the multiverse to recollect her soul. And in like this one Marguerite is a bitch who enjoys meddling and fucking up her other lives. Oh and actually Conley and Josie are an item (in a lot of them) so that’s cute. But her parents are fucking psycho trying to bring Josie back… Side note OG Marguerite keeps ducking with her life in the Russiaverse (just leave yourself alone, you already got her preggo) but at least she feels remorse? So Anyways in the backstoryverse OG Marguerite plots with Paul and Theo in this dimension and they make a plan to use each others bodies in different dimensions to take down the triad. When Marguerite finally puts all the pieces of Paul back together he starts to believe that they are not destined for love but for pain (but lowkey they kinda synonymous in books like these) so he’s being all skeptical and she’s like let’s get home and regroup. Great right, clean slate going to take down the Triad in the last book? WRONG bitch Marguerite takes over her body using the bad green stuff that was killing Theo in the first one. And evil spy Theo is back so that’s all super fun!! This was such a mindfuck.

title: A Million Worlds with You
review: Yet another mindfuck. So evil Marguerite basically starts to build traps to kill OG Marguerite in other worlds. Basically trying to make her “perfect traveler” status moot. She runs to an Egypt verse, Londonverse, Romeverse (medievalverse), and basically gets all of those Marguerites killed and OG doesn’t really do much to help. Paul is fighting his demons from being splintered and has basically decided he and Marguerite are no good for one another. As evil Marge or Wicked as OG Marguerite dubs her (Berkeleyverse is OG) attempts to destroy dimensions and kill the Marguerites there, Paul is able to somehow combat the science and stabilize dimensions. Okay and spy Theo from Triadverse kills Egyptverse Marguerite (Berkleyverse hops out before dying) but he is somewhat redeemable bc he ends up sacrificing himself (he hated himself for killing Marguerite) to destroy Triadverse Conley (honestly the Home Office and Triadverse Conley’s are the main villains). Basically, the dimensions start working together and then they are ultimately able to defeat the Home Office verse that was trying to resurrect Josie. They were able to have a conference of Marguerites because one dimension made clones (the Cloneverse) which was great (Paul easily identified each Marguerite), there was also a dimension where Marguerite was deaf and her and Paul already had a baby (also super cute). Marguerite was able to convince her parents to stop the search for Josie (they’d named the project “Project Eurydice” and I just really love that for some reason). Her parents from home office decide to seal their dimension to atone and fix Conley’s trap to destroy all of the worlds (basically he built a fail safe to bring back Josie, but Berkeleyverse Marguerite destroys the body…too). Anyways Marguerite has nothing to lose bc Paul dies in the body of Home Office Paul so after returning home (she had taken over Wicked’s body without Wicked’s conscious in it). She jumps back into her body that wicked had taken over while she had taken over Wicked’s (it’s super complicated) so Wicked is doing bad stuff to Berkeleyverse Theo and Berkeleyverse Josie in Berkeleyverse Marguerite’s body and then jumps out (to not get trapped there? I think the nightthief drug was wearing off or she was just waiting for Berkeleyverse Marguerite to come back) and they try to think of a way to save the Home Office from exploding (sealing the dimension has a 40% chance of collapsing the dimension undoing everything including influencing other dimensions—basically undoing the whole fucking trilogy) but then Wicked comes back and tries to destroy Berkeleyverse for good and then I guess hops back into her dimension? Just to be sealed? Idk. So Berkeleyverse is about to be destroyed but plot twist Paul is not dead and he and Marguerite put their firebirds together to save the universe, declare their love for one another, and that’s kinda the end. So like it was somewhat anticlimactic in ways, but after that second book I don’t think it could be topped. Oh and the home office does not explode so the whole trilogy was not unraveled. I’m kinda sad the trilogy is over but I also can’t think of anything else that could even happen

title: When Grumpy Met Sunshine
review: How fun and cute! I enjoyed this one. Sometimes passage didn’t fully feel coherent or transition well but like whatever. They were both really silly in general…and like not super transparent when they could’ve been but we needed a third act so….denying feelings is how we got here. Alfie is such a fun name for a serious guy and Mabel was goofy. Anyways good vibes

title: The Faking Game
review: OK, I started not really liking this one, but it grew on me in the end. I just sometimes have a hard time when they are like from wealthy families and have privilege and don’t actually have anything wrong with their lives. Like I really wanna have sympathy for the stalker situation but at the same time I just feel like “oh my God I’m so sad that you’re a gorgeous model and that you have a billionaire boyfriend who’s fake who’s actually so in love with you anyways” in the end, the spice was fun

title: Beyond The Bell
review: Honestly had a blast. Super duper messy principal and teacher??? but I thought it had good tension and plot and they were reasonably (could’ve been more) communicative but what can you do. Loved the side characters and the spice and the banter Oliver and Georgia were cute and entertaining dynamics

title: Teach Me A Lesson
review: This was great. There was definitely a lot of spice but sue me I’m horny and scared of men. Uhhh Mia and Elias were cute love a good childhood friends to lovers the brother was ofc overbearing but whatever. The family was also depressing but whatever. Honestly it was spicy and had decent other plot. Can I really ask for more?

title: Strictly Extracurricular
review: This was fine. I liked how Lina and Dom were super honest and communicative until ofc the third act. And then when that hit it was kinda ehhh. Also this five year old is way to fucking smart (which was kinda the point but still) uhh I really liked it until the third act point bc they were so healthy and respectful and then it was like really dumb and mushy and like idk could’ve been avoided…if they had kept doing what they were doing before.

title: Digging Dr Jones
review: Idk this was fine ig. It just feels like she’s incompetent and then has a few insights and then it brilliant. I wish it had been like an enemies to lovers where she was trying to compete with him and was acting dumb and then plot twist boom she’d been plotting the whole time!! But then they end up together kind of thing. Also weird that it’s Andrew and Adrianna….like why. Also I had Thor and Dr Jones playing in my head the entire time. Overall meh

title: Love Sick
review: I didn’t hate it! Had fun, honestly though it very much a keep my head down and stay out of drama and that all sounded like a mess. But it gave some good plot and the characters were likable and fun. Julian honestly was such a sweetheart but it really pissed me off when he didn’t call Grace by her actual name but then it was better but I kinda wish he’d given her a nickname rather than using the name she explicitly said not to use felt like a boundary thing. Anyways it was still cute, solid read

title: A Forbidden Alchemy
review: Honestly I have no idea what just happened…it was really good though. I want to know what happens next. It felt bad that she was lying to him the whole time. And ofc he’s butthurt about her lying (which rightfully so) and the waves of lies had each hit him until the last straw. I feel like I like Patrick a lot more than I like Nina, but also I’m wondering if it was actually Polly who betrayed them? I literally am so confused. I wish all the books were out

title: Fall I Want
review: Bad bad bad. The book could’ve ended at 50% and I’d still dislike it. then to make me read another 200 pages of nothing???

title: Fall Too Well
review: Marginally better but still bad. There was more actual plot but like then the antagonist gives up at the climax but then doesn’t like choose a storyline. They’re really cringy together in an icky way

title: Swiped
review: Ehh this one was OK. I didn’t really feel like we got to see a lot of them interacting, which was unfortunate but the moments that they did were fun. I feel like there might’ve been some neurodivergent tendencies that were unaddressed but overall it was fine.

title: Give Me Butterflies
review: Very solid read. Great communication, super healthy, definitely some healing, but the trust was there the communication was there the expectations were set from the beginning and explicitly told to one another. Overall this was pretty refreshing to read. Super fun, glad the children actually felt like kids.

title: Ledge
review: I was very caught off guard by the ending of this book. I knew things were too resolved too quickly.

title: Witch Please
review: This was deeply bad. Didn’t like any of the side characters like at all. Then she doesn’t tell him she’s a witch? Like what???

title: The Paradise Problem
review: Okay not as bad as it could’ve been. The family was full of assholes but we knew that going in. Anna was eccentric, and West was kinda perfect but also not. Uhhh yeah it was fun and I read most of it in one sitting.

title: The Irresistible Urge to Fall For Your Enemy
review: Kinda loved. New world, definitely some fun moments. Solid read definitely see the Dramoine parallels. There’s a good amount of gore but I overall enjoyed. Good amount of build up and tension for the sequel. I hope we see more of the different orders.

title: Mistakes We Never Made
review: Hannah Alabama out here writing novels. And one that wasn’t bad! I’m impressed!! I was really worried that they were gonna put all of the blame on Emma, but I’m really glad that Finn and Sybil owned up to their lack of communication and straight up lying. I like that the characters were imperfect. I was surprised that they’re actually was depth in the book. Overall, it was a solid read.

title: Mate
review: So I like smut, but that was a lot of smut. Honestly just silly goofy wolfy antics was there anything else to expect?? I had a fun time. I love Ali Hazelwood still scared to read problematic summer romance but whatever.

title: Night of the Witch
review: Wait a minute I finished another book! It was okay. Definitely picked up at the end. But I was also not that invested and could live not knowing what happens next. That might just be the burnout talking. Anyways, witches and witch hunters fantasy and history. It was a fun journey overall.

title: The Bookshop of Secrets
review: I fear I’m not one for wwii stories but this was a new perspective of sorts. I think it really picked up in the end, but it was a more steady slower paced start. I am really pissed that it’s a series…the slow romance was so good. I think once the espionage really picked up I was engaged. I think the second book will be more engaging because the exposition has already been set.

title: A Season for Second Chances
review: Happy book one hundred!! This was sweet. Honestly more fiction than anything else and rather ordinary but in a good way. I do feel like it’s slow ish pace and coming of mid-age novel about change and restarting life.

title: The Man I Never Met
review: This kinda felt like the Tailor Swif video by ASAP Rocky. I thought I knew what was happening and then oh wait we have a cancer plot. I want to say it was good but it wasn’t. Like the initial romance..hard read…the dating the rebound for a year…so messy…and like we hardly saw them together. It felt like reading a summary instead of a plot. Anyways…

title: The Signature Move
review: This was kinda cute. It felt a little juvenile but overall it was fun. I mean they were young enough to have their whole personalities based on their sports, but I sped through it though!

title: The Valentine's Hate
review: This was like quintessential mediocre rom com book. Fake dating, third act, vacation getaway. It was fine but not great

title: The Tourist Attraction
review: This started good and went downhill. Like there was a coherence/consistency issue. It felt very much like mixed signals the whole time which was very confusing to read.

title: Faking Under the Mistletoe
review: This was fine. I didn’t read too deeply to be quite frank. I found the FMC irritating but I ended up being okay with the story and its ending. I just felt like this was a series of miscommunication and just avoidance. Not cute. Also no real spice boo

title: Heartless Hunter
review: This was really good. I was super into the suspense and my heart was in my chest the whole time. The author did an excellent job of putting the characters in difficult situations (climbing a tree then setting it on fire) the one love scene was really icky to me bc they both were using each other but like overall I really loved this book

title: Rebel Witch
review: What a fucking ending. I really liked this duology. It was gripping heart breaking. There was a feeling of the general good of people when their fear of others is minimized. There was lasting, enduring love, there was magic, there were plot twists and schemes and deception everywhere.

title: Accidentally in Bloom
review: This was okay…it was chaotic and remained chaotic. Gray’s feelings felt inconsistent…he liked her the whole time…?? But hated himself for it?? He was mad at her leaving even though she explicitly expresses this upfront?? Rose was also inconsistent but more understandable. They were also both very lusty which is fine but probably not lasting…

title: Wallflower in Bloom
review: Okay I liked this one alright. I just got tired of Violet needing validation from others about her looks and appearances. Like I get it was her insecurity but does it have to be her personality…??? Also this one had a weird premise with her being a fan girl

title: The Mating Game
review: This is the last one for the year!!! Honestly..ehh. It was good but not as good as Fake Mate. It was still spicy and fun…I thought there could’ve been more tension build up and the third act was really dumb. Overall it was solid but mostly okay
